(Constantinos Antonopoulos) | birth_place = [[Patras]], [[Greece]] | nationality = [[Greek people|Greek]] | occupation = CEO of [[Intralot]] | alma_mater = [[National Technical University of Athens]], [[University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology|University of Manchester (UMIST)]] }} '''Constantinos Antonopoulos''' ([[Greek language|Greek]]: '''Κωνσταντίνος Αντωνόπουλος''') is a founding member, shareholder and CEO of [[Intralot]]. ==Business== Constantinos Antonopoulos is a founding member and shareholder of [[Intralot]], a [[Greece|Greek]] company that supplies integrated [[gambling|gaming]], [[transaction processing system]]s, game content, [[sports betting]] management and interactive gaming services to state-licensed gaming organizations worldwide. In 1992, the year that the company was established, he assumed his current position as [[chief executive officer]].[http://www.intralot.com/content/108/constantinos-antonopoulos Constantinos Antonopoulos, Group CEO] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140311164418/http://www.intralot.com/content/108/constantinos-antonopoulos |date=2014-03-11 }} [[Intralot]] Under his leadership the company has grown its presence to 56 countries and its workforce to more than 5,500 people.[http://www.totallygaming.com/company/intralot-group Company profile] Totally Gaming He is the [[chairman]] of many companies of the group and a non - executive member of the [[board of directors]] of [[Intracom|Intracom Holdings]].[http://www.intracom.com/intracom_holdings/en/company/profile/management.htm Board of Directors] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140312224455/http://www.intracom.com/intracom_holdings/en/company/profile/management.htm |date=2014-03-12 }} Intracom Holdings In November 2014 Constantinos Antonopoulos resigned from his position as Intralot's CEO.[http://www.casinonewsdaily.com/2014/11/18/intralots-ceo-resigns-from-his-position/ INTRALOT’s CEO Resigns from His Position] ==Honors & Affiliations== Constantinos Antonopoulos was honored with numerous significant distinctions; among others he was distinguished internationally in the “Lottery industry Hall of Fame”,[http://lotteryindustryhalloffame.com/2007/constantinosantonopoulos.html C. Antonopoulos profile page] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130923172019/http://lotteryindustryhalloffame.com/2007/constantinosantonopoulos.html |date=2013-09-23 }} PGRI Lottery Industry Hall of Fame as one of the most important professionals in the [[Lottery|lottery industry]] An essential initiative that Constantinos Antonopoulos took was Intralot’s becoming a founding member of the Global Growth Companies community, the “New Champions of the [[World Economic Forum]]”.[http://www.weforum.org/community/global-growth-companies Global Growth Companies] Community of the [[World Economic Forum]] He is a member of the board of directors of the Federation of Greek Industries (SEV)[http://www.sev.org.gr/online/generic.aspx?id=387&lang=en Board of Directors] SEV, Hellenic Federation of Enterprises and participates in the Foreign Affairs Executive Committee of the Federation (SEV International). ==Personal info== Born in the city of [[Patras]], Constantinos Antonopoulos graduated in 1976 from the [[National Technical University of Athens]] with a degree in [[Electrical Engineering]]. He continued his studies at the [[University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology|University of Manchester (UMIST)]], [[England]] and received a Master of Science ([[M.Sc.]]) degree in [[Reliability engineering|Systems Reliability]]. He is married and father of three children. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.intralot.com/ Intralot] official website *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110926035829/http://www.intracom.com/ Intracom] corporate website {{DEFAULTSORT:Antonopoulos, Constantinos}} [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{about|the accounting practice|the ''Black Books'' episode|Cooking the Books (Black Books episode)|the New Zealand television cooking program|Cook the Books (TV program)}} {{Refimprove|date=September 2008}} {{accounting}} '''Creative accounting''' is a [[euphemism]] referring to [[accounting]] practices that may follow the letter of the rules of [[standard accounting practice]]s, but deviate from the spirit of those rules. They are characterized by excessive complication and the use of novel ways of characterizing income, assets, or [[Liability (financial accounting)|liabilities]] and the intent to influence readers towards the interpretations desired by the authors. The terms "innovative" or "aggressive" are also sometimes used. Other synonyms include '''Cooking the books''' and '''[[Enron Scandal|Enronomics]]'''.
The term as generally understood refers to systematic misrepresentation of the true [[income]] and [[asset]]s of corporations or other organizations. "Creative accounting" has been at the root of a number of [[accounting scandals]], and many proposals for [[accounting reform]] – usually centering on an updated analysis of [[capital (economics)|capital]] and [[factors of production]] that would correctly reflect how value is added.
Newspaper and television journalists have hypothesized that the [[stock market downturn of 2002]] was precipitated by reports of "accounting irregularities" at [[Enron]], [[MCI Inc.|Worldcom]], and other firms in the [[United States]].
One commonly accepted incentive for the systemic over-reporting of corporate income<ref>[[Corporate tax]]</ref> which came to light in 2002 was the granting of [[stock option]]s as part of [[executive compensation]] packages. Since stock prices reflect earning reports, stock options could be most profitably exercised when income is exaggerated, and the stock can be sold at an inflated profit.
The most notable activist is [[Abraham Briloff]] ([[professor emeritus]] of [[CUNY Baruch]]) who for years wrote a column for ''[[Barron's Magazine|Barron's]]'' that constantly analyzed breaches of ethics and audit professionalism among [[Certified Public Accountant|CPA]] firms. His book is called ''Unaccountable Accounting''.<ref>[[Abraham J. Briloff]]</ref> The profession, in turn, was not kind to Dr. Briloff<ref>{{Cite journal|date = |url = http://aaahq.org/PublicInterest/newsletr/spring99/item07.htm|last = Owsen|first = Dwight M.|journal = In the Public Interest|publisher = American Accounting Association|volume = 27|issue = 2|publication-date = Spring 1999|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20041221054447/http://aaahq.org/PublicInterest/newsletr/spring99/item07.htm|archivedate = December 21, 2004|title = The AICPA's Prosecution of Dr. Abraham Briloff, Some Observations}}</ref> but much of what he advocated has been forced on the industry in the wake of the [[Enron scandal]] (See [[Sarbanes-Oxley]]).
According to critic [[David Ehrenstein]], the term "creative accounting" was first used in 1968 in the film [[The Producers (1968 film)|''The Producers'']] by [[Mel Brooks]].<ref>[http://www.criterion.com/current/posts/918-the-producers The Producers - From the Current - The Criterion Collection<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==Earnings management== {{main|Earnings management}} Creative accounting can be used to manage earnings.<ref>{{cite web|title=Creative Accounting|url=http://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/creative-accounting.asp|publisher=Investopedia|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref> Earnings management occurs when [[Management|managers]] use judgment in [[financial reporting]] and in structuring transactions to alter financial reports to either mislead some [[Stakeholder (corporate)|stakeholder]]s about the underlying economic performance of a company or influence contractual outcomes that depend on reported accounting numbers.<ref>Healy, P. M. and J. M. Wahlen. 'A review of the earnings management literature and its implications for standard setting', ''Accounting Horizons'', December 1999, pp. 365–383.</ref>
==The motivations of creative accounting== *Personal incentives *Bonus-related pay *Benefits from shares and share options *Job security *Personal satisfaction *Cover-up fraud *Tax management *Management buyouts *Debt covenant *Manager's self-interest

Company Snapshot ">{{cite web | url=http://www.corporateinformation.com/Company-Snapshot.aspx?cusip=C380I5R10 | title=Damiani S.P.A. Company Snapshot | publisher=CorporateInformation.com | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> | parent = Leading Jewels S.A.<ref name="Company Overview of Damiani SpA">{{cite web | url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=26540287 | title=Company Overview of Damiani SpA | publisher=Bloomberg BusinessWeek | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> | divisions = | subsid = Rocca S.p.A.(2008)<ref name="Damiani Acquires Rocca S.p.A.">{{cite web | url=http://www.jckonline.com/2008/09/19/damiani-acquires-rocca-spa | title=Damiani Acquires Rocca S.p.A. | publisher=JCK | date=19 September 2008 | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> | homepage = {{URL|http://www.damiani.com}} | footnotes = }} '''Damiani S.p.A''' or ''Damiani Group'', is an Italian luxury [[jewelry]] [[corporate group]] that designs, manufactures, distributes and sells jewelry and luxury [[watches]].<ref name="Damiani S.p.A. eveluation">{{cite web | url=http://business.highbeam.com/company-profiles/info/774950/damiani-s-p-a | title=Damiani S.p.A. eveluation | publisher=HighBeam | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> It was founded in Italy in 1924. The company uses celebrity endorsements to market its products. In the early 2000s the company had a dispute with [[Brad Pitt]] and [[Jennifer Aniston]] regarding the use of their names and wedding ring designs. The dispute was settled for $50 million and the couple helped Damiani create and market a line of products.{{citation needed|date=February 2018}} Damiani expanded across Asia and the US. It went public in 2007. Its most well-known jewelry product brands are Salvini, Alfieri & St. John and Bliss.
==History== Damiani was founded in 1924 by Enrico Grassi Damiani, in [[Valenza]], [[Italy]]. It became popular among affluent Italians.<ref name="Damiani on sparkling form with new travel retail concept">{{cite web | url=http://moodiereport.com/document.php?doc_id=24288 | title=Damiani on sparkling form with new travel retail concept | publisher=The Moodie Report | date=28 October 2010 | accessdate=12 February 2014 | author=Pittilla, Mary Jane}}</ref> Damiani's son led the company from 1960-1990.<ref>{{cite web|title=Studi Societari|url=http://www.borsaitaliana.it/documenti/studi.htm?filename=96429.pdf|publisher=Borsa Italian SpA|accessdate=12 February 2014|language=Italian}}</ref> It started selling products on the US market in 2001 and introduced a $2.5 million ad campaign the following year.<ref name="two">Molofsky R. Damiani turns sights stateside. [[Jewelers of America#National Jeweler|National]] Jeweler [serial online]. April 16, 2002;96(8):22. Available from: Business Source Complete, Ipswich, MA. Accessed May 31, 2014</ref>
Damiani experienced negative press<ref name="two"/> after [[Brad Pitt]] and [[Jennifer Aniston]] filed a lawsuit. They said Damiani was selling reproductions of the ring custom-designed by Brad Pitt and made exclusively for their wedding in violation of their agreement with Damiani.<ref name="two"/> Damiani said they never made that agreement and that the rings were merely chosen from a collection of wedding rings.<ref name="Damiani says it owns the designs to Pitt and Aniston's wedding bands">{{cite web | url=http://www.jckonline.com/2001/08/09/damiani-says-it-owns-designs-to-pitt-and-anistons-wedding-bands | title=Damiani says it owns the designs to Pitt and Aniston's wedding bands | publisher=JCK Magazine | date=August 9, 2001 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=DeMarco, Anthony}}</ref> A settlement was reached for $50 million in January 2002. As part of the settlement, Mr Pitt designed a ring for Damiani, which Aniston would model in its advertisements for it.<ref name="five">N.A. Jewellery is the Pitts. Sunday Mail, The (Brisbane) [serial online]. n.d.;Available from: Newspaper Source Plus, Ipswich, MA. Accessed May 31, 2014.</ref><ref name="Pitt and Aniston settle rings case">{{cite web | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1758361.stm | title=Pitt and Aniston settle rings case | publisher=BBC News | date=13 January 2002 | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref>
By 2003 it had 25 stores which each sold a single brand of products, in Italy, Asia and the US.<ref>Demarco A. Store Brand: Damiani's Distinctive Look. Jck [serial online]. May 2003;174(5):152. Available from: Business Source Complete, Ipswich, MA. Accessed May 31, 2014.</ref>
In 2007, Damiani announced an [[initial public offering]], which valued the company at €150.8 million (USD$215.4 million) (in 2007 exchange rates).<ref name="Damiani IPO Kicks Off">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/beauty-industry-news/financial/damiani-ipo-kicks-off-478686?src=search_links | title=Damiani IPO Kicks Off | publisher=WWD | date=29 October 2007 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Kaiser, Amanda}}</ref> Rocca S.p.A., an Italian jewelry and watch retailer, was purchased by Damiani for €7 million (US$9.81 million) in 2008<ref name="Damiani Acquires Rocca S.p.A.">{{cite web | url=http://www.jckonline.com/2008/09/19/damiani-acquires-rocca-spa | title=Damiani Acquires Rocca S.p.A. | publisher=JCK | date=19 September 2008 | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref>
In 2010, Damiani had a net loss of €18.2 million (USD$25.6 million).<ref name="Damiani Posts Loss">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/accessories-news/jewelry/damiani-posts-loss-3118020?src=search_links | title=Damiani Posts Loss | publisher=WWD | date=15 June 2010 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Zargani, Luisa}}</ref> The company's estimated total sales (in 2010/2011) were €150 million.<ref name="Luxury">{{cite book | title=Luxury Brand Management | publisher=John Wiley & Sons | author=Chevalier, Michel | year=2012 | location=Singapore | isbn=978-1-118-17176-9}}</ref> In 2010, Birks & Mayors agreed to distribute all Damiani Group's brands, for five years, in the United States.{{Citation needed|date=May 2014}} In 2012, Damiani entered into a partnership with MingFung/Hengdeli Group to distribute its watches and jewelry in [[China]].<ref name="Damiani Enters Deal for China Distribution">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/fashion-news/fashion-scoops/damiani-enters-deal-for-china-distribution-5913563?src=search_links | title=Damiani Enters Deal for China Distribution | publisher=WWD | date=16 May 2012 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Zargani, Luisa}}</ref> Also, in 2012, Damiani received permission by the Government of India to invest in the Indian jewelry market.<ref name="Damiani Invests in India">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/accessories-news/jewelry/damiani-invests-in-india-6457831?src=search_links | title=Damiani Invests in India | publisher=WWD | date=26 October 2012 | accessdate=7 February 2014 | author=Turra, Alessandra}}</ref>
As of November 2012, Damiani had an annual revenue of €151.6 million (USD$193.3 million).<ref name="Creating Golden Opportunities Amid Austerity">{{cite web | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/11/27/fashion/creating-golden-opportunities-amid-austerity.html?_r=1& | title=Creating Golden Opportunities Amid Austerity | publisher=[[The New York Times]] | date=27 November 2012 | accessdate=12 February 2014 | author=Lankarani, Nazanin}}</ref> In the fiscal year ending March 2013, Damiani S.P.A. had sales of €137.82 million (USD$185.75 million)<ref name="Damiani S.P.A. Company Snapshot ">{{cite web | url=http://www.corporateinformation.com/Company-Snapshot.aspx?cusip=C380I5R10 | title=Damiani S.P.A. Company Snapshot | publisher=CorporateInformation.com | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> Currently, Damiani is run by the third generation of the Damiani family,<ref>{{cite web|title=Studi Societari|url=http://www.borsaitaliana.it/documenti/studi.htm?filename=99921.pdf|publisher=Borsa Italian SpA|accessdate=12 February 2014|language=Italian}}</ref> that has been on the board of directors since 1996.<ref name="Creating Golden Opportunities Amid Austerity"/>
In 2012, the company became the first jeweler to obtain the authorization to hold a 51% controlling interest in an [[India]]n-based entity, '''Damiani India'''.<ref name="Creating Golden Opportunities Amid Austerity"/> In November 2013, Damiani raised funds for the Italian Red Cross to support people affected by the storms in Sardinia by donating 20 percent of certain sales in Damiani’s flagship stores in Italy and watch retailer Rocca.<ref name="Damiani Launches Initiative for Sardinia">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/fashion-news/fashion-scoops/damiani-launches-initiative-for-sardinia-7294749?src=search_links | title=Damiani Launches Initiative for Sardinia | publisher=WWD | date=November 29, 2013 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Turra, Alessandra}}</ref>
The President Guido Damiani received the ''America Award'' of the [[Italy-USA Foundation]] in 2013.
==Brands== Damiani designs and markets jewelry and watches, as well as jewels and unique pieces.<ref name="Alchemy of desire">{{cite web | url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/alchemy-of-desire/1/239638.html | title=Alchemy of desire | publisher=India Today | date=27 December 2012 | accessdate=12 February 2014 | author=Bharadwaj, Chumki }}</ref> The company's major market is in Italy. It is sold in other major markets worldwide through subsidiaries and boutiques.<ref name="Sparkling Display">{{cite web | url=http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/lifestyle/235817-sparkling-display.html | title=Sparkling Display | publisher=The Edge Malaysia | date=24 April 2013 | accessdate=12 February 2014 | author=Tan, Amy }}</ref> It has won 18 consecutive Diamonds International Awards.<ref name="Damiani on sparkling form with new travel retail concept"/>
All Damiani suppliers are part of a restricted circle of selected organizations respecting [[United Nations|UN]] regulations on the certification and origin of conflict-free diamonds.<ref name="Damiani on sparkling form with new travel retail concept"/> There are 35 retail [[boutique]]s and 19 other franchises such as jewelry stores.<ref name="filename=89544">{{cite web|title=Studi Societari|url=http://www.borsaitaliana.it/documenti/studi.htm?filename=89544.pdf|publisher=Borsa Italian SpA|accessdate=12 February 2014|language=Italian}}</ref>
The main brands of Damiani are:<ref name="Damiani S.p.A welcomed at Dubai ">{{cite web | url=http://www.diamondworld.net/contentview.aspx?item=951 | title=Damiani S.p.A welcomed at Dubai | publisher=Diamond World News Service | date=24 September 2007 | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref><ref name="Damiani Company Overview">{{cite web | url=http://quotes.wsj.com/IT/MTAA/DMN/company-people | title=Damiani Company Overview | publisher=Wall Street Journal | accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> * Salvini * Alfieri & St. John * Bliss (which is distributed, in Japan, by BGioielli Ltd.)<ref name="Damiani Signs Deal for Youth Brand in Japan">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/business-news/financial/damiani-signs-japan-deal-1813350?src=search_links | title=Damiani Signs Deal for Youth Brand in Japan | publisher=WWD | date=1 October 2008 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Roberts, Andrew}}</ref> * Calderoni
==Marketing == [[File:FantaysBra-Chgo 2010-12-10 photoby-Bielawski-3.png|thumb|right|A $2 million Fantasy Bra designed by jeweler Damiani.]]Damiani collaborates with celebrities like [[Isabella Rossellini]], [[Brad Pitt]] and [[Jennifer Aniston]] to promote their products.<ref name="one">Gwyneth Graces Damiani Campaign. By: Ilari, Alessandra, WWD: Women's Wear Daily, 01495380, 11/1/2004, Vol. 188, Issue 93</ref><ref name="Damiani eyes expansion in Asia, Middle East">{{cite web | url=http://jewelleryoutlook.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=327 | title=Damiani eyes expansion in Asia, Middle East | publisher=Jewellery Outlook | date=20 March 2010 | accessdate=12 February 2014}}</ref> [[Gwyneth Paltrow]] was featured in its ads in 2004.<ref name="one"/>
Damiani created the "Aro Necklace, which Aro, a leader of the Volturi ruling vampire clan," in the Twilight movie, ''[[The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn – Part 2]]'', gives to [[Bella Swan]].<ref name="Damiani Designs Jewelry for 'Twilight'">{{cite web | url=http://www.wwd.com/fashion-news/fashion-scoops/jeweled-twilight-6486576?src=search_links | title=Damiani Designs Jewelry for 'Twilight' | publisher=WWD | date=14 November 2012 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Turra, Alessandra}}</ref> It also created the 2009 Harlequin Fantasy Bra, worn by model [[Marisa Miller]] during the Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show.<ref name="Damiani Designs Fantasy Bra for Victoria’s Secret">{{cite web | url=http://www.jckonline.com/blogs/style-360/2009/11/30/damiani-designs-fantasy-bra-victoria-s-secret | title=Damiani Designs Fantasy Bra for Victoria’s Secret | publisher=JCK Magazine | date=30 November 2009 | accessdate=6 February 2014 | author=Heebner, Jennifer}}</ref> The bra has an 18k gold frame with 2,355 colorless and cognac diamonds, with a focal point of a 16-carat, champagne-color, heart-shape diamond, for a total of nearly 150 carats total weight.<ref name="Damiani Designs Fantasy Bra for Victoria’s Secret"/>

'''Daniel Starch''' (1883–1979) was an American [[psychologist]] and [[marketing research]]er. He is considered to be one of the pioneers of marketing and consumer research in the early 20th century.
==Life== Starch received a [[Bachelor of Science|BS]] in mathematics and psychology from the Morning Side College in [[Iowa]]. After that he moved for postgraduation studies to the [[University of Iowa]], where he completed his [[Doctor of Philosophy|PhD]] in psychology in 1906. The advisor of his thesis was Charles E. Seashore. After that he worked briefly as a lecturer in Iowa and then went on to teach at [[Wellesley College]] in [[Massachusetts]] while pursuing further studies at [[Harvard University]]. In 1908 he became a professor at the [[University of Wisconsin]] where he stayed until 1919. From 1920 to 1926 he was a professor at Harvard University and in 1923 he founded the marketing research company Daniel Starch and Staff. Later he resigned from his position at Harvard to concentrate on his company and work in the private sector. In 1932 he worked as a consultant and director of a research department of the American Association of Advertising Agencies as well. Starch ran his own company for 50 years until his retirement in 1973 at the age of 90.<ref name="wisconsin"/><ref name="iowa"/>
==Work== Starch authored several books in the fields of psychology, advertising and marketing research. Best known are ''Experiments in Educational Psychology'' (1911) and his pioneering work about advertising ''Advertising: Its Principles, Practice, and Technique'' and its follow-up ''Principles of Advertising'' (1923). He researched and devised methods to assess the effectiveness of advertising, among them what was later to become known as the "Starch test" or "Starch recognition procedure". Also named after him is the "Starch formula", which describes how to determine the number of people recalling a full-page advertisement from the number of people recalling a half-page advertisement.<ref name="wisconsin"/><ref name="gabler"/><ref name="sage"/><ref name="mcgraw-hill"/>
===Works=== * ''Experiments in Educational Psychology'' (1911) * ''Advertising: Its Principles, Practice, and Technique'' (1914) * ''Principles of Advertising'' (1923) * with Hazel Martha Stanton, Wilhelmine Koerth, Roger Barton: ''Controlling Human Behavior: A First Book in Psychology for College Students'' (1936) * with Hazel Martha Stanton, Wilhelmine Koerth: ''Psychology in Education'' (1941) * ''Measuring Advertising Readership and Results'' (McGraw-Hill, 1966) * ''Look Ahead to Life: How to be a Fine Person'' (Vantage Press, 1973) * ''Educational Measurements'' * ''How to Develop your Executive Ability'' (1943)

University of Wisconsin Press 1949, {{ISBN|0-299-80572-7}}. pp. 334, 365 ({{Google books|8UyNxhlU650C|online copy|page=334}})</ref> <ref name="iowa">Joan H. Routledge 1991, {{ISBN|0-8058-0761-6}}, p. 45 ({{Google books|w5Vjh6xpLuwC|online copy|page=45}})</ref> <ref name="gabler">Thorsten Szameitat: ''Praxiswissen Anzeigenverkauf: So gelingt die Kommunikation zwischen Verlag, Agentur und Kunde''. Gabler Verlag 2010, {{ISBN|978-3-8349-2094-2}}, pp. 66–67 ({{Google books|Xwm-MXFNOLoC|online copy|page=66}})</ref> <ref name="sage">Pauline Maclaran, Mark Tadajewski, Barbara Stern, Michael Saren: ''The SAGE Handbook of Marketing Theory''. SAGE Publications 2009, {{ISBN|978-1-84787-505-1}}, pp. 61, 76, 82 ({{Google books|IfULgbFbQIoC|online copy|page=76}})</ref> <ref name="mcgraw-hill">Cathrine V. Jansson-Boyd: ''Consumer Psychology''. '''Ernesto Illy''' (July 18, 1925 – February 3, 2008) was an [[Italy|Italian]] [[food chemist]] and businessman, known as the chairman of the [[Illy|Illycaffè S.p.A]] coffee manufacturer.<ref>Dennis Hevesi, [https://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/06/world/europe/06illy.html Ernesto Illy, Chairman of Coffee Company, Is Dead at 82] from ''[[The New York Times]]''</ref> He was deeply and widely respected, considered "an absolute giant" in the world of coffee and espresso,<ref name="prince" /> spearheading Illy's research into coffee and espresso quality, as summarized in his son [[Andrea Illy|Andrea]]'s book ''Espresso: The Chemistry of Quality,'' written with Ernesto's assistance.
== Biography == Born in [[Trieste]], Illy was the son of the Hungarian-Italian chocolate maker [[Francesco Illy]], a [[World War I]] officer, who had established the espresso making company in 1933. Ernesto studied [[chemistry]] at [[University of Bologna]] (1947) and immediately joined Illy, and later took over the company from his father (1956). Ernesto created a high-tech manufacturing process, specializing in the making of [[espresso]] coffee, for which he also was an [[Evangelism|evangelist]]. He was chairman of Illy 1963-2004 and then honorary chairman. Ernesto Illy took part in the establishment of [[Association Scientifique Internationale pour le Café]] (chairman, 1991-).
He was married to Anna Rossi. The Illy company is run by their son [[Andrea Illy]] (born 1964),<ref>R. W. Apple, [https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A0CE3D71731F937A15753C1A9679C8B63&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=2 Discovering la Dolce Vita in a cup] from ''The New York Times'' (Oct 24, 2001)</ref> and among the board members are the daughter [[Anna Illy]] and son [[Riccardo Illy]] (born 1955), who has also been mayor of [[Trieste]] and President of [[Friuli-Venezia Giulia]] region. Their first son, Francesco, is also involved.<ref>[http://www.winespectator.com/blogs/show/id/51649 ''Small is big.''] from [[Wine Spectator]], May 26th, 2015</ref>
==Awards== * [[Cavaliere del Lavoro]] of Italy (Knight of Industry, 1994) * honorary doctorates and master's degrees (such as [[University of Udine]], 2005)<ref name="prince">{{Harv|Prince|2008}}</ref> * [[Centromarca]] brand organization (president, 1996-) * [[Specialty Coffee Association of America]] (S.C.A.A.). "Lifetime Achievement Award" (1997) * [[Monte Carmelo (Brazil)]] county (honorary citizenship, 2002) * [[International Coffee Organization]], London (chairman of the promotion committee, 2002-) * [[Anacafè]] member of the order, Flor del Cafè (Guatemala, 2004).

'''Fidel Kuri Grajales''' (born 24 February 1962) is a [[Mexican people|Mexican]] businessman and politician from the [[Institutional Revolutionary Party]] (PRI). He serves as a deputy to the [[LXIII Legislature of the Mexican Congress]], representing Veracruz's 15th electoral district, which includes the city of [[Orizaba]]. He also served as a deputy in the [[LXI Legislature of the Mexican Congress|LXI Legislature]].<ref name="sil">{{cite web|title=Perfil del legislador|url=http://sil.gobernacion.gob.mx/Librerias/pp_PerfilLegislador.php?SID=&Referencia=9218983|publisher=Legislative Information System|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> He is the incumbent chairman of the [[Tiburones Rojos de Veracruz]].
==Political and business career== Kuri Grajales was born on 24 February 1962 in Orizaba and pursued an undergraduate degree in business administration, which he abandoned in 1981.<ref name="sil"/> He started his political career in the 1990s in the PRI, becoming president of a municipal committee. He also was involved in various transportation and other business chambers.
From 1998 to 2000, Kuri served on the LVIII Legislature of the Congress of Veracruz, presiding over the Public Works and Communications Commission and serving on the Territorial Limits and Civil Protection Commissions. During this time, he was a substitute deputy to the LVII Legislature. He would be a substitute local deputy to the LX Legislature of Veracruz; during this time, he was part of the PRI's Veracruz State Directive Committee and assisted in get out the vote efforts for PRI deputies in the lead-up to the 2006 general elections.<ref name="sil"/>
He also started a business career, becoming director general of Transmilenia, a construction company. In 2009, while Kuri was serving his first term as a federal deputy, his company was criticized for abandoning paving work on a highway in [[Nogales, Veracruz]].<ref>{{cite news|work=Vázquez Chagoya|url=http://archivo.vazquezchagoya.com/?p=7508|date=25 November 2009|title=CONSTRUCTORA DE FIDEL KURI ABANDONA OBRA MILLONARIA|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> A reputation for incomplete projects has continued to dog Transmilenia; one 2015 report called it the company's "hallmark"<!--sello característico-->.<ref>{{cite news|work=El Buen Tono|date=29 May 2015|accessdate=1 June 2016|url=https://www.elbuentono.com.mx/caracteriza-a-kuri-abandono-de-obras/|title=Caracteriza a Kuri abandono de obras}}</ref>
In 2009, Kuri was elected to serve what would be the first of two terms in the federal Chamber of Deputies, representing Veracruz's 15th electoral district. During his first tour in [[Palacio Legislativo de San Lázaro|San Lázaro]], he sat on the Youth and Sports, Communications, Citizen Participation, Tourism and Gender Equality Commissions.<ref name="sil"/>
Three years after the end of the LXI Legislature, Kuri returned to the Chamber of Deputies, representing the same electoral district for the PRI. He currently sits on the Sports, Finances and Public Credit, and Housing Commissions of the Chamber of Deputies; he is the chairman of the former.<ref name="sil"/>
In 2017, Kuri Grajales launched a campaign to become mayor of the [[Veracruz (city)|city of Veracruz]].<ref name="mayor">{{cite news|url=http://www.animalpolitico.com/2017/05/kuri-veracruz-equipo-tiburones-femexfut/|work=Animal Político|title=Fidel Kuri mezcla política y futbol en campaña, pese a prohibición en estatuto de Femexfut|date=3 May 2017|accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref>
==Sports== Kuri Grajales has owned several soccer teams. In 2008, he bought his local team, the [[Albinegros de Orizaba]], who played in the [[Ascenso MX|Liga de Ascenso]]. In 2011, he transferred the franchise to the state government, which moved it to Veracruz as the Tiburones Rojos.<ref>{{cite news|work=Sexenio|first=Constancia|last=Izquierdo|url=http://www.sexenio.com.mx/articulo.php?id=4761|date=20 May 2011|title=Fidel Kuri cede franquicia de Albinegros}}</ref>
Kuri then bought the [[C.F. La Piedad|Reboceros de La Piedad]], which earned promotion to the Liga MX in 2013. The team was relocated from Michoacán to Veracruz to become the most recent incarnation of the Tiburones Rojos, effectively promoting the Veracruz team. When they won the [[Copa MX]] in April 2016, Kuri allowed [[Héctor Yunes Landa]], the PRI's candidate for governor, to hoist the cup.<ref>{{cite news|work=Vice México|url=https://sports.vice.com/latinamerica/article/fidel-kuri-diputado-mediocre-pero-con-poder|date=18 April 2016|accessdate=1 June 2016|first=Iván|last=Pérez|title=FIDEL KURI: DIPUTADO MEDIOCRE… PERO CON PODER}}</ref> In 2015, ''[[Proceso (magazine)|Proceso]]'' reported that the deal to move to Veracruz had occurred by way of an indefinite contract, in which Governor [[Javier Duarte]] sold Kuri's company, Promotora Deportiva del Valle de Orizaba, A.C., the rights to the name, logo, stadium and practice facilities at no cost. This contract was never signed by the state congress and legally expired in January 2014, though Kuri continues to profit from the club's intellectual property.<ref>{{cite news|work=Proceso|date=21 December 2015|accessdate=1 June 2016|url=http://www.proceso.com.mx/424011/los-tiburones-del-veracruz-un-regalo-politico|title=Los Tiburones del Veracruz, un "regalo" político|first=Raúl|last=Ochoa}}</ref>
The [[Mexican Football Federation]] suspended Kuri Grajales from all soccer-related activities in January 2016 and imposed a fine of 146,000 pesos for being involved in an altercation with the head of the referees, [[Edgardo Codesal]].<ref>{{cite news|work=Televisa Deportes|url=http://deportes.televisa.com/futbol-mexicano/2016-01-22/ano-sancion-kuri-grajales/|title=Un año de sanción para Kuri Grajales|date=22 January 2016|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> He had previously been fined in 2014 for criticism of referees.<ref>{{cite news|work=Milenio|url=http://laaficion.milenio.com/veracruz/Fidel_Kuri_Grajales-bombardero-Veracruz-Tiburones_Rojos_0_637736390.html|date=30 November 2015|first=Alejandra|last=García|title=Fidel Kuri, el bombardero de Veracruz|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> In September 2016, after a match in Puebla, Kuri, still banned by the FMF, entered the press area and confronted a local reporter,<ref>{{cite news|work=ESPN|title=Fidel Kuri encaró a miembro de la prensa|url=http://espndeportes.espn.com/futbol/mexico/nota/_/id/2795969/fidel-kuri-encaro-a-miembro-de-la-prensa|date=20 September 2016|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref> earning him an 8-month extension to his suspension.<ref>{{cite news|work=Aristegui Noticias|url=http://aristeguinoticias.com/2309/kiosko/ocho-meses-mas-de-castigo-contra-diputado-del-pri-por-agredir-a-camarografo/|date=23 September 2016|accessdate=24 September 2016|title=8 meses más de castigo contra diputado del PRI y dueño del Veracruz, por agredir a camarógrafo}}</ref> Journalists who witnessed the confrontation noted that Kuri was drunk.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.univision.com/deportes/futbol/liga-mx/pese-a-estar-inhabilitado-fidel-kuri-se-pasea-en-zona-mixta-e-insulta-a-reportero?hootPostID=50c25923188a5dad2b661370b84d21d1|work=Univisión Deportes|date=20 September 2016|accessdate=21 September 2016|title=Pese a estar inhabilitado, Fidel Kuri se pasea en zona mixta e insulta a reportero}}</ref>
In May 2016, Kuri Grajales became the center of controversy when he threatened to move the Tiburones Rojos if the PRI did not win the impending gubernatorial elections; Tamaulipas, Sinaloa and Yucatán were floated as potential landing pads for the franchise. These statements ran contrary to Article 7 of the Code of Ethics of the Mexican Football Federation, which require team owners to "maintain a neutral position in political and religious matters".<ref>{{cite news|work=Animal Político|date=31 May 2016|title=Si no gana el PRI, hay riesgo de que Tiburones Rojos se vaya de Veracruz: Kuri Grajales|url=http://www.animalpolitico.com/2016/05/si-no-gana-el-pri-hay-riesgo-de-que-tiburones-rojos-se-vaya-de-veracruz-kuri-grajales/}}</ref> One week later, Kuri changed his mind and announced that, even though the PRI had lost the election, the Tiburones Rojos would remain in Veracruz.<ref>{{cite news|work=Milenio|date=6 June 2016|url=http://laaficion.milenio.com/veracruz/tiburones-rojos-queda-veracruz-fidel-kuri-grajales-futbol-liga-mx_0_751125212.html|title="Tiburones Rojos se quedan en Veracruz": Fidel Kuri|first=Héctor|last=González Villalba|accessdate=24 June 2016}}</ref>
Kuri was additionally criticized during his Veracruz mayoral campaign for using the team as part of his campaign, including a logo featuring a shark, mixing team and campaign messages on his personal account, and the campaign slogan ''Veracruz de primera'', which also refers to the team remaining in Liga MX.{{r|mayor}}

{{use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox sportsperson | name = Hans Bergsland | fullname = | nickname = | nationality = | residence = | birth_date = {{birth date|1878|11|15|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Oslo|Kristiania]], Norway | death_date = {{death date and age|1956|6|9|1878|11|15|df=yes}} | death_place = Oslo, Norway | height = | weight = | country = | sport = [[Fencing]] | event = | collegeteam = | club = Kristiania FK | team = | turnedpro = | coach = | retired = | coaching = | worlds = | regionals = | nationals = | olympics = [[1908 Summer Olympics|1908]], [[1912 Summer Olympics|1912]] | highestranking = | pb = | show-medals = yes }} '''Hans Bergsland''' (15 November 1878 – 9 June 1956) was a Norwegian [[fencing|fencer]], sports official and businessperson.
He was born in [[Oslo|Kristiania]], was an older brother of [[Jacob Bergsland]] and represented the fencing club Kristiania FK. He competed at the [[1908 Summer Olympics|1908]] ([[Fencing at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's épée|épée]]) and [[1912 Summer Olympics]] ([[Fencing at the 1912 Summer Olympics – Men's épée|épée]] and [[Fencing at the 1912 Summer Olympics – Men's team épée|team épée]]).<ref name=sref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/be/hans-bergsland-1.html |title=Hans Bergsland Olympic Results |accessdate=2010-04-05 |work=sports-reference.com}}</ref>
He [[examen artium|finished]] his secondary education in 1897, took commercial education in Germany, France and England<ref name=merkbio/> and the [[cand.philol.]] degree in 1901.<ref name=obit/> From 1916 to 1922 he ran the company [[Peter Petersen & Co]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Generalkonsul Peter Petersen – 100 års jubileum|date=3 April 1946|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=7|language=Norwegian}}</ref> He was the chief executive of Helsingborg Galoger and co-owner of Sandnes Kamgarn Spinneri.<ref name=merkbio>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Bergsland, Hans|url=http://runeberg.org/merkbio/0145.html|encyclopedia=[[Merkantilt biografisk leksikon]]|publisher=Yrkesforlaget|location=Oslo|edition=1st|editor-last=Hoffstad|editor-first=Einar|editor-link=Einar Hoffstad|year=1935|page=69|accessdate=28 April 2012|language=Norwegian}}</ref> He was a supervisory council member of [[Livsforsikringsselskapet Fram]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Fram – liv og brand|date=6 May 1939|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=9|language=Norwegian}}</ref> and deputy member of [[Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse|date=13 December 1935|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=7|language=Norwegian}}</ref>
He was a member of [[Bærum]] [[municipal council (Norway)|municipal council]], and was a board member of the municipal cinematographer.<ref name=merkbio/> He chaired his own fencing club and the [[Norwegian Fencing Federation]], and was a board member of the [[Norwegian Trekking Association]]. Among others, he worked with the 50 kilometre ski slope in [[Holmenkollen]].<ref name=obit>{{cite news|title=Hans Bergsland død|date=11 June 1956|work=[[Aftenposten Aften]]|page=2|language=Norwegian}}</ref>
He received the [[King's Medal of Merit|King's Medal of Merit in gold]] and the Swedish Olympia Medal, and was decorated as a Chevalier of the [[Legion of Honour]]. He died in 1956.<ref name=obit/>

{{Infobox person | name = Ilias Psinakis | image = Ilias psinakis.jpg | alt = | caption = Psinakis in 2018 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|04|08|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Athens]], Greece | nationality = Greek | other_names = | occupation = Mayor, manager, Greek television personality | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }} '''Ilias Psinakis''' ({{lang-el|Ηλίας Ψινάκης}}; born 8 April 1958) is a Greek politician, manager, and television personality.
In 2014, Psinakis was elected Mayor of [[Marathon, Greece|Marathon]], located in the administrative region of Attica, Greece. His five-year term began in September 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://site.marathon.gr/dimarxos.html|title=Δήμαρχος - Άρθρα|author=Administrator|work=marathon.gr}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://site.marathon.gr/|title=marathon.gr|work=marathon.gr}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Psinakis was born in the [[Philippines]] to Panagiotis and Alice Psinakis. His father owned an electronics factory. While attending university in the [[UK|United Kingdom]], Psinakis studied international business and marketing, eventually receiving master's degrees in both.<ref>''Eklogika''. [http://www.eklogika.gr/page/dimoi_viografika_attiki/psinakis_ilias-cv "Δήμαρχος Μαραθώνος, Ηλίας Ψινάκης, βιογραφικό"] ("Marathon Mayor, Elias Psinakis, biography"). Retrieved 8 December 2016 {{El icon}}.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.grreporter.info/en/most_unconventional_character_greek_show_business_became_athens%E2%80%99_first_municipal_council/3709|title=The most unconventional character in Greek show business became Athens’ first municipal council|work=GRReporter.info|accessdate=8 December 2016}}</ref><ref>Municipality of Marathon. [http://site.marathon.gr/dimarxos.html "Δήμαρχος: Ηλίας Ψηνάκης"] ("Mayor: Ilias Psinakis"). Retrieved 8 December 2016 {{El icon}}.</ref>
==Career==
===Modeling and entertainment=== Early in his career pursuits, Psinakis worked as a fashion model.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newpost.gr/lifestyle/142515/utan-o-ilias-psinakis-doyleye-os-montelo-foto|title=Όταν ο Ηλίας Ψινάκης δούλευε ως μοντέλο... |work=newpost.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> After modeling, Psinakis went on to work as a writer for a Greek television series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://joytv.gr/%CE%B7%CE%BB%CE%AF%CE%B1%CF%82-%CF%88%CE%B9%CE%BD%CE%AC%CE%BA%CE%B7%CF%82-%CE%B7-%CE%AC%CE%B3%CE%BD%CF%89%CF%83%CF%84%CE%B7-%CE%B9%CF%83%CF%84%CE%BF%CF%81%CE%AF%CE%B1-%CF%84%CE%BF%CF%85-%CE%BC%CE%B5/|title=Ηλίας Ψινάκης: Η άγνωστη ιστορία με τους... Απαράδεκτους - JoyTv|work=JoyTV|accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> His next career move was as manager for the Greek singer [[Sakis Rouvas]]. After his 16-year working relationship with Rouvas ended in 2004, Psinakis decided to manage his own entertainment career, later appearing as a judge on Greek television [[reality show]]s such as [[Super Idol (Greek TV series)|Super Idol]], Dream Show, [[Ellada Eheis Talento|Greece, and You have Talent (Greek:Ελλάδα Έχεις Ταλέντο)]]. During this time period, Psinakis continued to work as a manager for several singers and actors in Greece.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yupiii.gr/celebrities/ilias_psinakis.html|title=Celebrities: Ηλίας Ψινάκης - yupiii.gr|work=yupiii.gr}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fthis.gr/article/267958/ilias-cinakis|title=Ηλίας Ψινάκης|work=fthis.gr}}</ref>
===Politics===
====City council==== In 2010, Psinakis began his political involvement when elected to the Athens city council alongside [[Nikitas Kaklamanis]]. In addition to working to promote a favorable image of Athens in Greece and abroad, Psinakis initiated and supported the project "For a Plate of Food" designed to provide assistance to the poor in Athens. Organised in collaboration with the Archdiocese of Athens and the government organization "Apostoli", thousands of Athens' needy were provided free food and assistance.<ref>[http://www.iefimerida.gr/news/32898/%CE%B5%CE%BA%CF%83%CF%84%CF%81%CE%B1%CF%84%CE%B5%CE%AF%CE%B1-%CF%88%CE%B9%CE%BD%CE%AC%CE%BA%CE%B7-%CE%B3%CE%B9%CE%B1-%C2%AB%CE%AD%CE%BD%CE%B1-%CF%80%CE%B9%CE%AC%CF%84%CE%BF-%CF%86%CE%B1%CE%90%C2%BB ΓΙΑ ΟΣΟΥΣ ΔΕΝ ΕΧΟΥΝ ΟΥΤΕ ΤΑ ΠΡΟΣ ΤΟ ΖΗΝ Εκστρατεία Ψινάκη για «ένα πιάτο φαΐ» Πηγή: Εκστρατεία Ψινάκη για «ένα πιάτο φαΐ» ]</ref><ref>[http://www.espressonews.gr/%CF%80%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8C%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%BF/62689/%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%B1-%CF%80%CE%B9%CE%AC%CF%84%CE%BF-%CE%B3%CE%B5%CE%BC%CE%AC%CF%84%CE%BF-%CE%B1%CE%B3%CE%AC%CF%80%CE%B7 ΓΡΗΓΟΡΗΣ ΜΕΛΑΣ. Ενα πιάτο γεμάτο αγάπη]</ref>
====Mayor==== Psinakis became a candidate for Mayor of the Municipality of Marathon in 2014. A resident there for more than twenty years at the time of his candidacy, the area's citizens elected him for the position in the first voting round on May 18, 2014 with 53.55% of the total vote.<ref>[http://www.ypes.gr/el/the Ministry of Interior of Greece]</ref><ref>http://ekloges-prev.singularlogic.eu/may2014/dn/public/index.html Page of Municipal Elections in Greece</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thetoc.gr/eng/politics/article/victors-from-the-first-round|title=Victors from the first round.|author=Euthimis Tsiliopoulos|work=The TOC In English}}</ref> Psinakis was sworn into office in August 2014. During his inauguration speech, the new mayor gave his vision for Marathon and the surrounding region that included a focus on transparency, meritocracy and development.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.protothema.gr/elias-psinakis-is-the-mayor-of-marathon/|title=Elias Psinakis is the Mayor of Marathon|work=protothema.gr}}</ref>
On August 3, 2018, following the [[2018 Attica wildfires|disastrous fires]] in the region, the municipal council of Marathon passed unanimously a resolution characterising Psinakis "undesirable", "incapable" and "extremely dangerous even to the physical health of the municipality's citizens", and demanding his resignation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.efsyn.gr/arthro/horis-ton-psinaki-synedriazei-dimotiko-symvoylio-marathona|title=Ομόφωνη απόφαση για παραίτηση του Ηλ. Ψινάκη|work=Εφημερίδα των Συντακτών}}</ref> Psinakis refused to resign, characterising the action as planned unconstitutional procedure that is not provided for by law and has no legal precedent. According to him it only had purpose of "spoofing and anthropophagy". Instead of politicking, he urged to manage the consequences of this disaster in a climate of solidarity and joint effort.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.protothema.gr/greece/article/810398/psinakis-den-paraitoumai-den-meteho-se-mia-methodeumeni-adisudagmatiki-diadikasia/|title=Ψινάκης: Δεν παραιτούμαι, δεν μετέχω σε μια μεθοδευμένη αντισυνταγματική διαδικασία|work=Proto Thema}}</ref>
=====Projects and activities=====
In early 2015, Psinakis was appointed head of international public relations for the Central Union of Municipalities (KEDE).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/ilias-psinakis-the-mayor-of-marathon-and-the-head-of-news-photo/461749652|title=Ilias Psinakis the mayor of Marathon and the head of international...|author=Pacific Press|work=Getty Images|accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> In his association with the appointment, Psinakis has worked to return the Parthenon Marbles, also known as the [[Elgin Marbles]], to Greece from the British Museum in London.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thetoc.gr/eng/culture-arts/article/new-demonstration-for-the-return-of-the-parthenon-marbles|title=New demonstration for the return of the Parthenon marbles|work=The TOC In English}}</ref> Psinakis' other activities as mayor include participation in [[Hellenic Parliament|the Hellenic Parliament]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.best-tv.gr/news/aytodiikitika/24752-patoylis-kafantaris-kai-psinakis-sti-vouli.html/|title= Στην... πρώτη γραμμή Πατούλης, Καφαντάρης και Ψινάκης στη Βουλή (pics)|work=best-tv.gr|accessdate=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.karfitsa.gr/2015/05/07/o-psinakis-o-mpoytaris-kai-to-kotero-f|title= Ο Ψινάκης, ο Μπουτάρης και το… κότερο!(ΦΩΤΟ)|work=karfitsa.gr|accessdate=28 May 2015}}</ref>
In an effort to honor on Greek athletes, celebrities, philanthropists, entertainers, and other notable individuals internationally, Psinakis created the Medal of the Legion of Marathon in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.star.gr/Pages/Ellada.aspx?art=279043&artTitle=deite_o_ilias_psinakis_efivre_to_parasimo_tis_legeonas_tou_marathona_gia_na_anavathmisei_ton_dimo|title=ΔΕΙΤΕ:ο Ηλίας Ψινάκης εφηύρε το Παράσημο της Λεγεώνας του Μαραθώνα για να αναβαθμίσει τον Δήμο!|work=star.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> In May of that year, Psinakis presented the first of this award to the [[President of Greece|President of the Hellenic Republic]] [[Prokopis Pavlopoulos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.protothema.gr/politics/article/477642/to-doro-tou-psinaki-ston-paulopoulo/|title=Συνάντηση στο Προεδρικό Μέγαρο. Ψινάκης σε Παυλόπουλο: Είσαι το πρώτο μέλος της λεγεώνας του Μαραθώνα|work=protothema.gr|accessdate=28 May 2015}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ethnos.gr/article.asp?catid=22767&subid=2&pubid=64189887|title=Ο Ψινάκης παρασημοφόρησε τον Πρόεδρο της Δημοκρατίας|work=ethnos.gr|accessdate=28 May 2015}}</ref> Subsequent recipients of the award have been [[Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople|Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.antenna.gr/news/life/article/425730/o-ilias-psinakis-sto-fanari|title=Ο Ηλίας Ψινάκης στο Φανάρι|work=antenna.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> [[Hollywood]] director [[James Cameron]], [[Jim Gianopulos]] of [[20th Century Fox]], actors [[Tom Hanks]] and [[Rita Wilson]], and thirty-seven foreign ambassadors from around the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espressonews.gr/showbiz/2016/09/152492/presveytes-toy-marathona|title=Πρεσβευτές του Μαραθώνα|work=espressonews.gr|accessdate=2 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nocomments.gr/news/lifestyle/84544/o-psinakis-fernei-holigoynt-sto-marathona|title=Ο Ψινάκης φέρνει το Χόλιγουντ στο Μαραθώνα|work=nocomments.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> Recipients of the award are given the title "World Ambassador of Marathon".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tlife.gr/Article/Ilias-PSinakis-Parasimoforise-37-presveis-se-mia-entyposiaki-vradia-sto-Marathona-Video-kai-fotografies/0-9-90351.html|title=Ηλίας Ψινάκης: Παρασημοφόρησε 37 πρέσβεις σε μια εντυπωσιακή βραδιά στο Μαραθώνα!|work=Tlife.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thediplomat.gr/2015/11/03/%CE%BB%CE%B1%CE%BC%CF%80%CF%81%CE%AE-%CF%84%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%B5%CF%84%CE%AE-%CF%80%CE%B1%CF%81%CE%B1%CF%83%CE%B7%CE%BC%CE%BF%CF%86%CF%8C%CF%81%CE%B7%CF%83%CE%B7%CF%82-37-%CF%80%CF%81%CE%AD%CF%83%CE%B2/|title=Mayor of Marathon honoured 37 foreign Ambassadors with the medal of the Legion of Marathon|work=thediplomat.gr|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.news.gr/politikh/politika-prosopa/article/270246/synanthsh-koryfhs-gioynker-psinakh.html|title=Συνάντηση κορυφής Γιούνκερ – Ψινάκη!|work=news.gr|accessdate=22 June 2016}}</ref>
Psinakis established the non-profit Marathon Foundation in order to further tourism, sports, and culture in the region as well as promote charitable events for the needy that provide food, water and medical care throughout Greece.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://we24.gr/2016/01/prepi-na-anagennisoume-ti-chora/|title=Πρέπει να αναγεννήσουμε τη χώρα|author= Μιχάλης Οικονομάκος|work=we24.gr|accessdate=9 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marathonfoundation.org/|title=Marathon Foundation, official website|accessdate=14 June 2016}}</ref>
In an effort to unite the various regions of Greece containing antiquities as well as historical and cultural landmarks, Psinakis established the Amphictyony of Ancient Greek Cities (Greek: Αμφικτυονία Αρχαίων Ελληνικών Πόλεων) in March 2016. Headquartered in Marathon, the focus of the association is protection and propagation of Greek cultural heritage and support of cultural interests. Since its inception, numerous municipalities in Greece have become member cities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tovima.gr/society/article/?aid=658343|title=Αμφικτυονία Αρχαίων Δήμων με σύμπραξη προσωπικοτήτων από Ελλάδα και εξωτερικό|work=tovima.gr|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.argolikeseidhseis.gr/2016/03/blog-post_749.html|title= Στην Αμφικτυονία αρχαίων ελληνικών πόλεων ο Δήμος Ναυπλιέων|work=argolikeseidhseis.gr|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amna.gr/pressReleaseView.php?id=106061&doc_id=16441733|title= (Ξένη δημοσίευση) - ΑΝΑΚΟΙΝΩΣΗ ΤΥΠΟΥ- ΥΠΟΥΡΓΕΙΟ ΕΣΩΤΕΡΙΚΩΝ & ΔΙΟΙΚΗΤΙΚΗΣ ΑΝΑΣΥΓΚΡΟΤΗΣΗΣ - Ο Υπουργός ΕΣΔΑ κ. Παναγιώτης Κουρουμπλής παραβρέθηκε σήμερα στην Τελετή Υπογραφής Πρωτοκόλλου Συνεργασίας για την ίδρυση ''Αμφικτυονίας Αρχαίων Ελληνικών Πόλεων''|work=amna.gr|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://24wro.com.gr/825624/amfiktionia-archeon-ellinikon-poleon-me-tin-ipografi-ilia-psinaki/#|title= Αμφικτυονία Αρχαίων Ελληνικών πόλεων με την υπογραφή Ηλία Ψινάκη!|work=24wro.com.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thestival.gr/policy/self-government/item/241581-amfiktyonia-arxaion-ellinikon-poleon-synergasia-metaksy-perifereion-kai-dimon-tis-b-elladas|title=Αμφικτυονία Αρχαίων Ελληνικών Πόλεων: Συνεργασία μεταξύ Περιφερειών και Δήμων της Β. Ελλάδας|work=thestival.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://24wro.com.gr/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/deltio-typoy_hyatt_20.05.2016.pdf|title= κατάλογος με τους Δήμους και τους Δημάρχους|work=24wro.com.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aboutkastoria.gr/ti-ine-dimiourgia-amfiktionias-archeon-ellinikon-poleon-pou-ipegrapsan-psinakis-petropoulos/|title= Τί είναι η δημιουργία Αμφικτυονίας Αρχαίων Ελληνικών Πόλεων που υπέγραψαν Ψινάκης – Πετρόπουλος; (βίντεο)|work=aboutkastoria.gr|accessdate=24 May 2016}}</ref>
In an effort to revitalize Marathon, Psinakis has worked with Greek and Chinese investors to create a [[Riviera|Riviera-style]] attraction and international tourist destination. Part of Psinakis' plan for Marathon's future is constructing an entertainment center that includes a casino, marina, hotels, villas, and a golf course.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iefimerida.gr/news/261643/elliniko-las-vegkas-ston-shinia-etoimazei-o-ilias-psinakis-kazino-spa-kai-viles-eikones|title= Ελληνικό Λας Βέγκας στον Σχινιά ετοιμάζει ο Ηλίας Ψινάκης -Καζίνο, σπα και βίλες [εικόνες]|work=iefimerida.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.euro2day.gr/1415863/article.aspx|title= Νέες ελπίδες για την "Αθηναϊκή Ριβιέρα"|author=Φώτης Κόλλιας|work=m.euro2day.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dealnews.gr/roi/item/172348-O-M%CE%B1%CF%81%CE%B1%CE%B8%CF%8E%CE%BD%CE%B1%CF%82-%CE%BC%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%81%CE%B5%CE%AF-%CE%BD%CE%B1-%CE%B3%CE%AF%CE%BD%CE%B5%CE%B9-%CE%9B%CE%B1%CF%82-B%CE%AD%CE%B3%CE%BA%CE%B1%CF%82#.V0Ipn5GLS9J|title= O Mαραθώνας μπορεί να γίνει Λας Bέγκας;|work=dealnews.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref> Additional plans by Psinakis for Marathon are for Marathon Lake, a park that would include boating as well as bike jogging trails paths.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.protothema.gr/politics/article/441081/o-ilias-psinakis-metatrepei-ti-limni-marathona-se-sedral-park/|title= Ο Ηλίας Ψηνάκης μετατρέπει τη λίμνη Μαραθώνα σε... Σέντραλ Παρκ!|author=Κάσσι Φιλιππιτζή|work=protothema.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref> In cooperation with the Regional Governor of Attica, the culture minister, and the mayor of Lavrio, Psinakis is also working on a scuba diving park that would be centered around the Evian Gulf.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://portalgreece.gr/culture/scuba-diving-park-archaeological-interest-evian-gulf/|title= Scuba diving park of Archaeological Interest in Evian Gulf|work=portalgreece.gr|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref> Other efforts toward making his city a tourist destination include a trip made by Psinakis to China in May 2016, where he took part in investment negotiations for the construction of a history museum in Marathon.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dimotisnews.gr/news.php?id=2865|title= Ο Ηλίας Ψηνάκης έφερε 400.000.000 δολάρια ΗΠΑ στον Μαραθώνα από την Κίνα|work=dimotisnews.gr|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iapopsi.gr/%CE%BF-%CF%88%CE%B9%CE%BD%CE%AC%CE%BA%CE%B7%CF%82-%CE%AD%CF%86%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B5-%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%B4%CF%8D%CF%83%CE%B5%CE%B9%CF%82-400-%CE%B5%CE%BA%CE%B1%CF%84-%CE%B4%CE%BF%CE%BB%CE%AC/|title= Ο Ψινάκης έφερε επενδύσεις 400 εκατ. δολάρια για το Μαραθώνα|author=Μιχ Κα|work=iapopsi.gr|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref>

[[South Africa]]n | occupation = Executive | known_for = Co-founding [[Styloko]] and [[23snaps]] | alma_mater = [[University of the Witwatersrand]] | years_active = | title = | | website = }} '''Ivailo Jordanov''' ({{lang-bg|Ивайло Йорданов}}) is a business executive and the co-founder of [[Styloko]][https://www.forbes.com/sites/montymunford/2014/10/17/the-problem-with-online-shopping-has-been-the-choice/ "Styloko Confronts The Paradox Of Choice In Clothes Shopping Online"] ''Forbes''. '''Jan Bárta''' (born 9 August 1942 in [[Prague]]) is a [[Czechs|Czech]] [[architect]] and [[preservationist]]. He has written several books about historic preservation and is a specialist in the area of facades and plaster on historic buildings. He is also known as an advocate for restoration of the monument of [[Joseph Radetzky von Radetz|Josef Radetzky]] in Prague, which was removed in 1921.
In 1991 Jan Bárta together with [[chemist]] [[Jiří Rathouský]] founded a company to produce facade colours, hydrophobic coats and other chemicals aimed for restoration of historic houses.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.euro.cz/byznys/jan-bartasametova-revoluce-prisla-pozde-878812|title=Jan Bárta: Sametová revoluce přišla pozdě - Euro.cz|date=2006-02-20|work=Euro.cz|access-date=2018-07-30|language=cs}}</ref> It has been the exclusive supplier of facade colours for the historic buildings of Prague Castle and various other historic monuments of [[Czech Republic|Czechia]] and elsewhere.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.top09.cz/regiony/jihocesky-kraj/tiskove-zpravy/kandidatka-top-09-v-jiznich-cechach-22894.html|title=Kandidátka TOP 09 v jižních Čechách|last=|first=|date=|work=TOP 09|access-date=2018-07-30|language=cs-CZ}}</ref>
In 2011 Jan Bárta founded ''Spolek Radecký Praha'' (Radetzky Association Prague), which aims to commemorate [[Joseph Radetzky von Radetz|Field marshall Radetzky]] and for several years has been advocating for the restoration of Radetzky's monument on [[Malostranské náměstí]] in Prague. This endeavour has been supported by numerous historians.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.radio.cz/de/rubrik/spazier/fehlendes-monument-radetzky-denkmal-soll-zurueck-auf-den-kleinseitner-ring|title=Fehlendes Monument: Radetzky-Denkmal soll zurück auf den Kleinseitner Ring {{!}} Radio Prag|work=Radio Praha|access-date=2018-08-01|language=de}}</ref> Bárta stresses that Radetzky was a great Czech historical personality from an old Bohemian noble family and the monument was a beautiful work of art.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://rp-online.de/politik/oesterreich-feiert-den-legendaeren-heerfuehrer-der-habsburger_aid-18277941|title=Österreich feiert den legendären Heerführer der Habsburger|last=|first=|date=|website=RP ONLINE|language=de|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-01}}</ref> In an interview for Czech online newspaper iDNES.cz, Bárta stated that the nationalist concept of Czech history in the 20th caused many great persons (such as Radetzky) to be almost forgotten, so his aim is to correct that.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://praha.idnes.cz/marsal-radecky-malostranske-namesti-socha-navrat-f7l-/praha-zpravy.aspx?c=A171115_364705_praha-zpravy_nuc|title=Spolek hledá peníze a termín pro návrat Radeckého na Malostranské náměstí|date=2017-11-15|website=iDNES.cz|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref> In 2016 the association held great celebrations of 250 years since Radetzky's birth in his birthplace [[Sedlčany]] (under the patronage of the municipal government) and in [[Prague]]. In Sedlčany a commemorative plaque was unveilded.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.radio.cz/de/rubrik/tagesecho/ehrung-in-der-heimat-sedlcany-enthuellt-gedenktafel-fuer-josef-radetzky|title=Ehrung in der Heimat: Sedlčany enthüllt Gedenktafel für Josef Radetzky {{!}} Radio Prag|last=|first=|date=|work=Radio Praha|access-date=2018-08-01|language=de}}</ref>
Since 2013, he is the vice-charman of the [[Club for old Prague]] – an important preservationist organisation in Prague.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.zastarouprahu.cz/menu-horni/o-klubu/organy-klubu/kategorie-4/|title=Orgány Klubu|last=|first=|date=|website=Klub Za starou Prahu|language=cs|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref>
Bárta is a [[Monarchism|monarchist]] and member of the [[Koruna Česká (party)|Koruna Česká]] (Czech monarchist party), since 2014 he has been the party's [[hejtman]] (regional chairman) for [[Bohemia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.korunaceska.cz/volby-2017/kandidati/671-jan-barta|title=Ing. arch. Jan Bárta|last=|first=|date=|website=Koruna Česká|language=cs-CZ|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-01}}</ref>

[[File:Lumber yard sorting table, Falls City, Oregon (3229272695).jpg|thumb|250px|A lumber yard sorting table in [[Falls City, Oregon]]]] [[File:Albany Lumber Yard 1870s.png|thumb|Frank A. Jagger loads his boat full of lumber at the [[Albany Lumber District]] in [[Albany, New York]] in the 1870s]]
A '''lumber yard''' is a location where [[lumber]] and [[wood]]-related products used in [[construction]] and/or [[home improvement]] projects are processed or stored. Some lumber yards offer [[retail]] sales to consumers, and some of these may also provide services such as the use of [[Thickness planer|planer]]s, saws and other large machines.
Generally, '''timber yards''' are locations where raw [[Trunk (botany)|logs]] and other wood or [[forest product]]s are processed and stored.<ref>Döring, Stephan (2012). [https://books.google.com/books?id=NU-NhpbJxFsC&pg=PA72 ''Power from Pellets: Technology and Applications'']. Springer. pp. 72-74. {{ISBN|3642199623}}</ref> The terms "lumber yard" and "timber yard" are sometimes used interchangeably, and timber yards may include additional aspects that lumber yards encompass, and vice versa.
==Overview== Lumber yards sell products made at [[lumber mill]]s,<ref name="PT"/> where customers pick up products at the yard themselves or request that an order be built and delivered to them by the lumber yard. Lumber yards may also sell wood-plastic composites, such as [[Trex (Composite Material)|Trex]], any other type of construction material or supplies, and general [[hardware store]] [[household hardware|items]]. Lumber yards are the primary resources for contractors and homeowners when construction material is needed. [[Home Depot]] stores also have lumber sections, but this may not be considered a ''lumber yard'', although it serves the same purpose. Lumber yards use [[forklift|forklift trucks]] to move the large heavy units of lumber around the yard. [[Saw]]s may also be available to cut boards to a desired length for customers.
At timber yards (also sometimes referred to as lumber yards), logs and other forest products are processed and stored. Additional activities include inspection for signs of rot, utilizing stacking techniques to prevent rot from forming, and the removal of bark and spraying of pesticides to prevent insect infestation.<ref>Jahnel, Franz (2000). [https://books.google.com/books?id=4QTfTINjQtUC&pg=PA67 ''Manual of Guitar Technology: The History and Technology of Plucked String Instruments'']. Bold Strummer. p. 67. {{ISBN|0933224990}}</ref> Some lumber/timber yards use [[Crane (machine)|crane]]s to move logs, and sprinklers to keep the logs moist.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.enterprise-journal.com/news/article_94442a0c-58ff-11e2-bae0-0019bb2963f4.html?mode=image&photo=0 | title=Lumber yard a busy place | publisher=''[[Enterprise Journal]]'' (McComb, Mississippi) | accessdate=14 October 2013 | author=Hall, Phillip}}</ref>
==By country==
===United Kingdom===
====England==== Ransfords, located in [[Shropshire]], England, operates one of the largest timber yards in Europe,<ref>Flint, David; Owen, Andy (contributors) (1995). [https://books.google.com/books?id=CAWbNFyJLjUC&pg=PA64 ''Geography in Action,'']. Heinemann. Volume 1. p. 64. {{ISBN|0435351141}}</ref> and processes 70,000 tonnes of logs annually.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ransfords.co.uk/company/ | title=About us | publisher=Ransfords.co.uk | accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref>
===United States===
====Products==== Some lumber yards sell products that are assessed and certified by the [[Forest Stewardship Council]]'s (FSC), per its standards. One lumber yard in [[Portland, Oregon]] limits its product line to only those that meet or exceed FSC's requirements.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://portlandtribune.com/sl/158972-one-of-a-kind-lumber-yard-only-stocks-wood-that-meets-fsc-rules- | title=One-of-a-kind lumber yard only stocks wood that meets FSC rules | publisher=''[[Portland Tribune]]'' | date=August 15, 2013 | accessdate=14 October 2013 | author=Law, Steve}}</ref> In 2008, Sustainable Northwest, a nonprofit environmental group in Portland, Oregon, began operations sourcing and purveying environmentally friendly "green wood" products.<ref name="PT">{{cite web | url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304703104575174541891049132 | title='Green Wood' Lumberyard Out on a Limb | publisher=''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' | date=April 12, 2010 | accessdate=14 October 2013 | author=Carlton, Jim}}</ref> The group specializes in offering wood products that are sourced from trees in non-threatened forests.<ref name="PT"/>
====Fires==== In the United States, the [[National Fire Protection Association]] has been documenting incidences of lumber yard fires since 1998.<ref name="HCN">{{cite web | url=http://m.homechannelnews.com/article/recent-lumberyard-fires-bring-attention-safety | title=Recent lumberyard fires bring attention to safety | publisher=Home Channel News | accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref> Products at lumber yards are very prone to fires, and electrical problems at lumber yards are a significant causation of fires.<ref name="HCN"/> In [[Murray, Utah]], after a large lumber yard fire caused approximately US$1 million in damage at the CECO Concrete Construction company, city residents called for companies in the city to take further preventative actions to prevent fires from occurring.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ksl.com/?nid=148&sid=3719268 | title=Neighbors calling for fire prevention requirements after lumberyard fire | publisher=KSL News | date=July 9, 2008 | accessdate=14 October 2013 | author=Johnson, Whit}}</ref> In some cities, such as [[Phoenix, Arizona]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://phoenix.gov/webcms/groups/internet/@inter/@dept/@fire/@prev/documents/web_content/094048.pdf | title=Lumber Yards, Mulch Yards and Woodworking Facilities | publisher=Phoenix.gov | accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref> city fire protection and prevention codes for lumber yards exist.
==History== In [[Sydney]], Australia, [[convict]]s have worked at a place called "The Lumber Yard"<ref>Beckett, Gordon (2013). [https://books.google.com/books?id=6lBG3bAogvwC&pg=PA283 ''Reflections of Time'']. Trafford Publishing. pp. 283-284. {{ISBN|1490700080}}</ref><ref>Beckett, Gordon (2012). [https://books.google.com/books?id=oRNkzUriMhgC&pg=PA33 ''A Brief Economic History of Colonial Nsw'']. Trafford Publishing. p. 33. {{ISBN|1466928042}}{{Self-published inline|certain=yes|date=January 2018}}</ref> as a part of serving their sentences, to facilitate lumber and product production and to provide convicts with skills training.<ref>Beckett 2013, pp. 125-132</ref> A timber yard that was associated with The Lumber Yard was also in operation, where workers pulled and stacked logs floated downstream on the [[Lane Cove River]].<ref>Beckett 2013, pp. 136-138.</ref> The Lumber Yard was a government lumber yard, and operated as such from circa 1791 to 1834.<ref>Beckett 2013, pp. 125-126</ref>
==See also== * [[Logging]] * [[Sawmill]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==Bibliography== * Beckett, Gordon (2013). [https://books.google.com/books?id=bCDj6FWgSFkC&pg=PA125#v=onepage&q&f=false ''The Coghlan Factor'']. Trafford Publishing. pp. 125–132. {{ISBN|149070020X}}{{Self-published inline|certain=yes|date=January 2018}}
==Further reading== * Coberly, A.C. (1919). [https://books.google.com/books?id=DPMoAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false ''Life in a Lumber Yard'']. Retail Lumberman. * {{cite web | url=http://www.tcpalm.com/news/2013/sep/03/historical-vignettes-lumber-yards-mills-and-builde/ | title=Historical Vignettes: Lumber yards, mills and builders' supplies | publisher=TCPalm | accessdate=14 October 2013 |author1=Luckhardt, Alice L. |author2=Luckhardt, Greg E. }}{{spaced ndash}} Includes historical information about lumber yards in Florida's [[Treasure Coast]] area * Rietz, Raymond Carl (1970). [https://books.google.com/books?id=--1kxF6fujYC&pg=PA1 ''Air drying lumber in a forklift yard'']. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Forest Service, Forest Products Laboratory. Volume 209 of USDA Forest Service research note FPL. pp. 1–16.

{{Infobox Mayor |name= Manuel Egozcue Cintrón |image= ManuelEgozcue-Cintron.jpeg |imagesize= 120px |caption= [[File:San Juan Seal.jpg|75px]] |office= [[List of mayors of San Juan, Puerto Rico|Mayor of San Juan, Puerto Rico]] |term= 1900 |predecessor= [[R.M. Blanchford]] |successor= [[José Ma. Marxuach]] |term_start1=1901 |term_end1= 1903 |predecessor1=[[José Ma. Marxuach]] |successor1= Jose R. Latimer |birth_date= 1855 |birth_place= [[Bilbao, Spain|Bilbao]], [[Spain]] |death_date= 1906 |death_place= [[San Juan de Puerto Rico]] |profession= Businessman, Politician |party= [[Puerto Rican Volunteers Corps|Unconditional Spanish Party]], [[Puerto Rican Republican Party]] }}
'''Manuel Egozcue y Cintrón''' was born in [[Bilbao]], [[Spain]] in 1855. After completing university he emigrated to [[Puerto Rico]], then an overseas [[province]] of Spain, to pursue commercial projects; quickly becoming prominent in island business circles.
He became an active member of the [[Partido Incondicional Español]] (the [[loyalist]] Spanish Unconditional Party) and held important public offices under the Spanish government, including the vice presidency of the ''Diputación Provincial'' (Provincial Legislature). In 1896 he was honored by the government with the [[Orden del Mérito Naval]] for services rendered to Spain's navy.
After the American occupation he joined the newly formed [[Republican Party of Puerto Rico]] (whose main goal was obtaining statehood status for the Island) and was assigned a place on its board of directors, working closely with party founder [[José Celso Barbosa]].
During the municipal elections of 1900, the first to be held since the beginning of the American occupation, the Republican Party achieved an overwhelming victory; this resulted in Egozcue Cintrón becoming [[Alcalde]] of [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]], a position he held until elected a member of the [[Legislative Assembly of Puerto Rico|First House of Delegates]] for the 1901-1902 term. Following the House's seasonal adjournment he was reappointed to fill the unexpired term of Alcalde.
In 1904 he was again elected mayor, but this last term would be truncated when territorial governor [[William Henry Hunt (judge)|William Henry Hunt]] ordered his removal from office following a corruption scandal that tainted much of city government. Although he was ultimately acquitted of all charges the ordeal nevertheless left him much affected, requiring his internment in a psychiatric hospital. Mayor Manuel Egozcue Cintrón died shortly after in 1906.
During Egozcue Cintrón's various terms as mayor an urban police corps was created to patrol the city. Also, $600,000 worth of [[municipal bond]]s were issued, resulting in full payment of city debt and the completion of an [[aqueduct (water supply)|aqueduct]].
''The accompanying portrait of mayor Egozcue Cintrón is from a contemporaneous [[Pen and ink|ink drawing]] by Puerto Rican political [[caricaturist]] Mario Brau de Zuzuárregui.''

Alliance] | footnotes = }} '''Medicon Valley''' is a leading international [[life sciences|life-sciences]] cluster in [[Europe]], spanning the [[Greater Copenhagen (metropolitan region)|Greater Copenhagen region]] of eastern [[Denmark]] and southern [[Sweden]]. It is one of Europe's strongest life science clusters, with a large number of life science companies and research institutions located within a relatively small geographical area. The name has officially been in use since 1997.
Major life science sectors of the Medicon Valley cluster includes [[pharmacology]], [[biotechnology]], [[Health technology|health tech]] and medical technology. It is specifically known for its research strengths in the areas of [[neurological disorders]], [[inflammatory diseases]], [[cancer]] and [[diabetes]].
== Background and activities == The population of Medicon Valley reaches close to 4 million inhabitants. In 2008, 60% of Scandinavian pharmaceutical companies were located in the region. The area includes 17 universities, 32 hospitals, and more than 400<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mediconvalley.com/industry/database|title=Medicon Valley Database|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-05-18}}</ref> life science companies. 20 are large pharmaceutical or medical technology firms and 170 are dedicated biotechnology firms. Between 1998 and 2008, 100 new biotechnology and medical technology companies were created here. The biotechnology industry alone employs around 41,000 people in the region, 7,000 of whom are academic researchers<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mva.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/State_of_Medicon_Valley_2017.pdf|title=Medicon Valley report 2017|last=|first=|date=|website=Medicon Valley Alliance|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>.
International companies with major research centres in the region include [[Novo Nordisk]], [[Baxter International|Baxter]], [[Lundbeck]], [http://www.leo-pharma.com/ LEO Pharma], [https://www.hemocue.com/ HemoCue] and [[Ferring Pharmaceuticals]]. There are more than 7 [[science park]]s in the region, all with a significant focus on life science, including the [[Medicon Village]] in Lund, established in 2010. Companies within Medicon Valley account for more than 20% of the total GDP of Denmark and Sweden combined.<ref name="Basic Info">{{cite web|url=http://mva.org/medicon-valley/ |title=Medicon Valley Region |publisher=Medicon Valley Alliance |accessdate=26 December 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|url= |title=The life science cluster of Medicon Valley, Scandinavia |author1=Asheim, B. |author2=J. Moodysson |lastauthoramp=yes |publisher=University of Lund |journal=CIRCLE |date=2008 }}</ref>
Medicon Valley is promoted by [[Invest in Skåne]] and Copenhagen Capacity.<ref>[http://www.mediconvalley.com/ Medicon Valley]</ref>
Many of the region's universities have a strong heritage in biological and medical research and have produced several Nobel Prize winners<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/lists/all/create_list.html?active=1&cat%5B%5D=phy&cat%5B%5D=che&cat%5B%5D=med&year1=Type+year&year2=Type+year&laureate=Type+a+name+or+names+of+a+Laureate&born_in%5B%5D=14&born_in%5B%5D=46&born1_year=0&born1_month=0&born1_day=0&born2_year=0&born2_month=0&born2_day=0&sorting=default&photos=1|title=Nobel Prize Laureates life-science SE and DK|last=|first=|date=|website=Nobelprize.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref>. The almost century-long presence of a number of research-intensive and fully integrated pharmaceutical companies, such as Novo Nordisk, H. Lundbeck and [[LEO Pharma]], has also contributed significantly to the medical research and business development of the region by strengthening abilities within applied research, attracting suppliers and producing spin-offs.<ref name="History">[http://mva.org/about-mva/mvas-history/ MVA's History] Medicon Valley Alliance</ref>
== Science parks == [[Science parks]] Medicon Valley includes:
* [http://www.cobis.dk/en Copenhagen Bio Science Park] (COBIS) * [https://ideon.se/ Ideon Science Park] (largest of its kind in Scandinavia) *[https://symbion.dk/ Symbion] * [http://www.krinova.se/en/ Krinova Science Park] * [[Medicon Village]] * [http://www.medeon.se/en-us/ Medeon Science Park] * [[Scion DTU]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
== Sources and further reading == * {{cite web|url=http://www.mediconvalley.com/Facts/Medicon%20Valley%20Facts|publisher=Medicon Valley|title=Medicon Valley Facts|accessdate=26 December 2015}} * {{cite web|url=http://mva.org/medicon-valley/|publisher=Medicon Valley Alliance|title=Medicon Valley Region|accessdate=26 December 2015}} * {{cite journal|url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/237065497_The_Medicon_Valley_in_Denmark_and_Sweden_an_emerging_northern_star|title=The Medicon Valley in Denmark and Sweden: an emerging northern star? |author=M. Akinola ''et.al.'' |publisher=Grenoble Ecole de Management & Lab-Center for Competitiveness |date=2012}} A case study. * {{cite journal|url=http://www.oecd.org/gov/regional-policy/publicationsdocuments/Oresund.pdf|title=The case of Oresund (Denmark-Sweden) – Regions and Innovation: Collaborating Across Borders |journal=OECD Regional Development Working Papers |issue=21 |publisher=[[OECD]] Publishing |author=Nauwelaers, C., K. Maguire and G. Ajmone Marsan |date=2013 |doi=10.1787/20737009 }}
