{{Infobox person |image = Richard Attias.jpg |caption = Richard Attias in 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|11|19}} |birth_place = [[Fes]], [[Morocco]] |occupation = [[Businessman]] |nationality = [[Morocco|Moroccan]] |spouse = [[Cécilia Attias|Cécilia Ciganer-Albéniz]]
(2008–present) }} '''Richard Attias''' (born November 19, 1959) is a Moroccan{{fr}} Justine Boivin, [http://www.gala.fr/l_actu/on_ne_parle_que_de_ca/richard_attias_108183 Richard Attias, Un Prince charmant très influent], ''Gala'', 6 March 2008 events producer, founder and former chairman of [[PublicisLive]] and currently the executive chairman of Richard Attias and Associates. He is also the founder of The New York Forum and the co-founder of the Global Clinton Initiative and the Nobel Laureates Conference. From 1995 to 2008, he was the Executive Producer of the Davos Forum. == Background == Attias was born into a Moroccan Jewish family in the imperial city of Fes. He graduated as a civil engineer from the [[Institut national des sciences appliquées de Toulouse]], and got a master in Mathematics and Physics from the Paris University. He began his career as a sales executive at [[IBM]] France and in 1986 became the General Manager of Econocom France and Econocom Japan, a computer leasing company. During the 1990s, Attias founded an Event Management Company and produced various global events including the Zurich Insurances, [[Egypt]] Economic Development Conference for the Egyptian Government,https://www.cnbc.com/id/102502780#. IBM, conventions and [[Boris Yeltsin]]'s visit to France. Attias sold part of his company to [[Publicis]] in 1998 and founded a company which produced events for various clients including [[IBM]], [[l'Oreal]], [[Unilever]], [[BT Group|BT]], [[Avaya]], [[Lenovo]], [[Électricité de France|EDF]], [[Sanofi-Aventis]], and different governments. Attias was named Chairman of the Board of Publicis Dialog which combined the operations of Publicis Events and a range of marketing services. In 2004, Attias moved to New York and became chairman of Publicis Events Worldwide. Attias was the Chairman the Advisory Board of the Center on Capitalism and Society from 2009-2010.{{citation needed|date=December 2014}} In 2009, Attias founded Richard Attias and Associates, a strategic consulting firm with offices in New York, Paris, London, Rabat and Dubai, that supports government and non-governmental organizations worldwide, where he fulfills the position of Executive Chairman.[http://www.environmental-expert.com/companies/richard-attias-associates-78295 EnvironmentalExpert.] In December 2013, [[WPP plc|WPP]], the global marketing services company, has taken a 30% stake in RA&A.[https://www.theguardian.com/media/2013/dec/17/wpp-buys-stake-richard-attias-associates The Guardian.] Attias remains chairman of RAA. Since October 2013, Attias is a member of the 4Afrika Advisory Council, an external board of advisers tasked with guiding strategic investments undertaken by the [[Microsoft]] 4Afrika Initiative.[http://www.cnbcafrica.com/news/technology/2013/10/09/microsoft-4-afrika-initiative-launches-4afrika-advisory-council/ CNB Africa.] ===The New York Forum=== In 2010, he founded [[The New York Forum]],[http://observer.com/2010/05/gothams-new-davos-man/ Observer.] [http://www.lefigaro.fr/medias/2010/01/24/04002-20100124ARTFIG00163-new-york-forum-le-davos-de-richard-attias-.php Le Figaro.] an annual meeting to promote economic leadership and the New York Forum AFRICA in 2012. The first New York Forum AFRICA took place in Libreville, Gabon, from June 8 to June 10.[https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2012/05/02/the-new-york-forum-comes-to-africa/ Forbes.][http://africanbrains.net/2012/05/29/new-york-forum-africa-energy-digital-agriculture-tourism-diaspora-rethinking-africas-future/ African Brains.] The fourth edition of The New York Forum has been held at the NY Public Library on September 21st, 2014. The two main topics of discussions were 'Is technology killing jobs?' and 'What will be the economic impact of climate change?'.[http://www.lepoint.fr/monde/new-york-forum-acte-iv-20-09-2014-1864972_24.php Le Point.] ===Doha GOALS Forum=== {{Main|Doha GOALS}} In 2012, he launched the [[Doha GOALS]] Forum, a gathering of sport's leaders, which purpose is to use sports as a development tool.{{cite web|url=http://international-sports-marketing-chair.essec.edu/news-and-events/2012-11-doha-goals-forum |title=2012-11 Doha GOALS Forum - International Sports Marketing Chair |publisher=International-sports-marketing-chair.essec.edu |date= |accessdate=2014-08-20}} ===Other programs=== In 2008, Attias was named special advisor to the [[Emirate of Dubai]] to provide a comprehensive strategy to make the city a destination for major conferences, and cultural and sporting events.[http://www.ameinfo.com/155655.html Dubai Event Management Corporation appoints Richard Attias as Chief Executive Officer], ''Ameinfo.com'', 6 May 2008 From February 5 to 7, 2014, the first edition of the Build Africa Forum took place in [[Brazzaville]] (Republic of the Congo). Organized by RA&A under the High Patronage of [[Denis Sassou Nguesso]], President of the Republic of the Congo, it is the premier international business & investment forum focused on infrastructure in Africa.[http://www.lepoint.fr/afrique/economie/richard-attias-les-cles-de-la-nouvelle-afrique-12-02-2014-1790911_2033.php Le Point.] RA&A organized the XVth Francophonie Summit, the biennal meeting of the [[Organisation Internationale de la Francophonie]] (OIF). The event was held in Dakar, Senegal in 2014, with approximately 3000 participants.[http://www.rtl.fr/actu/international/richard-attias-non-l-afrique-ce-n-est-pas-que-des-emmerdes-7767612022 RTL.] For the first time, the summit was concluded by an economic forum on December 1–2.[http://www.lesechos.fr/idees-debats/cercle/cercle-121665-comment-lorganisation-internationale-de-la-francophonie-prepare-sa-charte-economique-1087805.php Les Echos] During this event, many political leaders, and CEO proposed to reinforce the links between this community, such as [[Macky Sall]], [[Alain Juppé]], or [[Thierry Breton]].[http://www.guineelive.com/index.php/component/content/article/8-actualite/1944-1er-forum-economique-de-la-francophonie-une-union-economique-francophone-a-batir-des-opportunites-de-developpement-economique-a-saisir Guineelive.] In 2015, he organised the [[Egypt Economic Development Conference]]. == Personal life == In 2008, Attias married the former wife of [[Nicolas Sarkozy]], [[Cécilia Attias|Cecilia Ciganer-Albeniz]]. He has lived in France, Switzerland, Japan, Dubai and New York.[http://www.gala.fr/l_actu/news_de_stars/cecilia_et_richard_attias_111096 Gala.] Attias also currently serves as Vice President for the Cecilia Attias Foundation for Women, which supports non-profit organizations dedicated to promoting women’s well being and equality worldwide. Attias was born into a Jewish family. He completed his studies in civil engineering at the [[Institut national des sciences appliquées de Toulouse]], and earned a masters in Mathematics and Physics from the [[University of Paris]].[http://www.lesechos.fr/economie-politique/france/interview/0202884535030-richard-attias-j-aurais-aussi-bien-pu-faire-archi-596942.php Les echos.] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.richardattiasassociates.com Richard Attias & Associates] {{DEFAULTSORT:Attias, Richard}} [[Category:1959 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Moroccan Jews]] [[Category:Moroccan businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Fez, Morocco]] [[Category:People named in the Panama Papers]]

{{Malay name|Rozali|Ismail}} {{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = [[Malay titles|Yang Berbahagia Tan Sri]] [[Doctor (title)|(Dr.)]] | name = Rozali Ismail | image = | caption = Tan Sri Rozali Ismail | birth_place = [[Selangor]], [[Malaysia]] | occupation = [[Entrepreneur|Founder]] of SYABAS | net worth =U$4.2billion | spouse = | children = | footnotes = }}
[[Malay titles|Tan Sri]] [[Doctor (title)|(Dr.)]] '''Rozali bin Ismail''' is a successful [[Malaysian people|Malaysian]] [[Malays (ethnic group)|Malay]] businessman. He is the founder and the Executive Chairman of Puncak Niaga Holdings<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/company-officers/PNHB.KL|title=Puncak Niaga Holdings Bhd (PNHB.KL)|last=|first=|date=|website=Reuters|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=4 Nov 2018}}</ref>, as well as the Executive Chairman of [[Syarikat Bekalan Air Selangor]] (SYABAS)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/people.asp?privcapId=13757267|title=Syarikat Bekalan Air Selangor Sdn. Bhd.|last=|first=|date=|website=Bloomberg|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=4 Nov 2018}}</ref>; a water concession company taken over by the government of [[Selangor]] in 2017.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://themalaysianreserve.com/2017/03/31/selangor-govt-decides-to-take-over-syabas-water-operations/|title=Selangor govt decides to take over Syabas water operations - The Malaysian Reserve|last=|first=|date=31 Mar 2017|website=themalaysianreserve.com|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref>
Rozali is also the president of the Malay Business Association of Selangor {DPMMS}.<ref name=mk141674/>
Rozali bin Ismail previously held the positions of President of the Water Association of Selangor, Kuala Lumpur & Putrajaya; Deputy President of the [[Malaysian Water Association]]; and Selangor State Representative at Malay Chamber of Commerce.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.marketscreener.com/business-leaders/Rozali-bin-Ismail-0728B4-E/biography/|title=Rozali bin Ismail - Biography|last=MarketScreener|website=www.marketscreener.com|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref>
=== Financials === Bin Ismail was listed as one of the 40 richest men in Malaysia in 2011<ref name=":0" /> with an estimated net worth of $155 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/84/malaysia-rich-10_Rozali-Ismail_JTR9.html|title=Malaysia's Richest - #35 Rozali Ismail|publisher=Forbes.com|date=26 May 2010|accessdate=19 December 2012}}</ref> According to Puncak Niaga Annual Report 2012, his total numeration fell within the RM33.3-RM33.4 million band during the financial year.{{Citation needed|date=November 2018}} His lucrative remuneration package has drawn public ire given the unsatisfactory level of water services in Selangor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.astroawani.com/news/show/investigate-syabas-bosss-rm33-4-million-salary-says-dap-17726}}</ref> His salary is a whooping RM 5.1 million a year.<ref>http://jelas.info/2009/03/20/water-scandal-summarising-bns-massive-conjob-or-how-you-are-making-the-super-rich-rozali-ismail-even-richer/</ref><ref>http://www.themalaysiantimes.com.my/miserable-residents-blast-syabas-for-unsystematic-water-supply/</ref>
=== Puncak Niaga === Puncak Niaga was founded by Bin Ismail in the 1990s.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=882666|title=Company Overview of Puncak Niaga Holdings Berhad|last=|first=|date=|website=Bloomberg|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref> The company orchestrated early water concession in Kuala Lumpur. Ismail's ties to Selangor politicians enabled him to facilitate public-private partnerships and influence the decision to employ a three-stage water treatment scheme in the region.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com.ua/books?id=5B00DwAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&hl=uk#v=snippet&q=puncak%20niaga&f=false|title=Asia after the Developmental State: Disembedding Autonomy|last=Carroll|first=Toby|last2=Jarvis|first2=Darryl S. L.|date=2017-10-12|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=9781107137165|language=en}}</ref>
Puncak Niaga is the parent company of SYABAS.<ref name=":0" /> In October 2015 both companies were taken over by the Selangor state government.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nst.com.my/news/2015/10/syabas-puncak-niaga-takeover-oct-15|title=Syabas, Puncak Niaga takeover on Oct 15|date=2015-10-03|work=NST Online|access-date=2018-11-04|language=en}}</ref>
In 2018 Syarikat Pengeluar Air Sungai Selangor (SPLASH) filed a suit against SYABAS, claiming RM 4.22 billion in outstanding receivables. According to the chairman of the [[Malaysian Chinese Association]] (MCA), Tan Gim Tuan, since the government took over, Syabas had reported massive annual losses every year. He further claimed that the suit could bankrupt the whole state.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/04/13/mca-is-selangor-govt-heading-towards-bankruptcy-following-splash-lawsuit/|title=MCA: Is Selangor govt heading towards bankruptcy following SPLASH lawsuit? - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref>
=== Politics === In the political scene, Rozali was the treasurer of [[United Malays National Organisation]] (UMNO) Selangor and UMNO Hulu Selangor Division. <ref name="mk141674">{{cite news|url=http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/141674|title=Rozali dicabar letak jawatan, tanding pilihan raya|publisher=Malaysiakini.com|date=1 September 2010|accessdate=19 December 2012}} Currently he is not holding any position in politics.</ref>
Rozali is also the adviser for the Sultan Idris Shah Polytechnics.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2012&dt=0520&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Kota&pg=wk_02.htm|title=8.2 peratus graduan PSIS dapat pekerjaaan|publisher=Utusan Malaysia|date=20 May 2012|accessdate=19 December 2012}}</ref>
Rozali bin Ismail is the Chairman of [[Gabungan Wawasan Generasi Felda]] (GWGF) – a group of 14 non-government organizations that speak for settlers and their families nationwide, estimated at some 600,000 people. In 2017 he called to disclose the identity of those responsible in the land ownership transfer, to reveal the identities of those involved in the suspicious RM200 million sale of Felda's land in Jalan Semarak.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nst.com.my/news/nation/2017/12/317325/expose-those-behind-shady-felda-deal|title=Expose those behind the shady Felda deal|last=Norrasyidah|first=Arshad|date=22 Dec 2017|work=New Straits Times|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref> In 2018 bin Ismail announced that GWGF would continue to support the [[Barisan Nasional|Barisan Nasional Party]] and the United Malays National Organization Government in Malaysia's 14th general election.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nst.com.my/news/politics/2018/04/354337/gwgf-pledges-continued-undivided-support-bn-and-najib|title=GWGF pledges continued, undivided support for BN and Najib|last=Arumugam|first=Tharanya|date=7 Apr 2018|work=New Straits Times|access-date=2018-11-04}}</ref>
==Awards & Recognition== He was bestowed the Socrates Awards, a prestigious award given to successful businessmen around the globe who contributed their ideas and experiences to the international community. Rozali Ismail is also an activist in promoting the local economy, politics, education and Malaysian culture to the world.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sinarharian.com.my/bisnes/puncak-niaga-terima-anugerah-antarabangsa-1.98412|title=Puncak Niaga terima anugerah antarabangsa|publisher=Sinar Harian|date=28 October 2012|accessdate=19 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/articles/PuncakNiagaterimaAnugerahSocrates/Article/|title=Puncak Niaga terima Anugerah Socrates|publisher=Berita Harian|date=29 October 2012|accessdate=19 December 2012}}</ref>
==Honour== ===Honour of Malaysia=== * {{flagu|Malaysia}} : Commander of the [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia#Commander|Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] (P.S.M.) (2000)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.istiadat.gov.my/index.php/component/semakanlantikanskp/|title=Semakan Penerima Darjah Kebesaran, Bintang dan Pingat}}</ref>

'''Sales outsourcing''' is a way for companies to attract increased, high volumes of sales for their products or services by using a third party. The company typically uses outsourcing companies to improve sales volumes without links to the sales teams that carry out those campaigns. The company that undertakes the outsourcing will normally be paid based on the results they are able to generate, and therefore creates a mutually beneficial situation for both client and the outsourcing company.
== Background == Full 'sales outsourcing' is observed when companies have an external third party [[sales]] force. It is differentiated from [[Value-added re seller|value added reselling]] or [[Distributor (business)|distribution]] in that the [[business model]] can be based on shared risk, although there are models where the outsourcer is paid for all of their activity - just as with a hired [[direct sales]] force, but the outsourcer provides rapidity, flexibility and experience. Other names for sales outsourcing include 'indirect sales' and 'channel sales'.<ref>{{cite book|last=Anderson|first=E|title=Outsourcing the sales function: The real cost of field sales|year=2005|publisher=Thomson/South-western|location=Mason, Ohio|author2=Trickle }}</ref>
Full sales outsourcing is different from [[telemarketing]] in that it requires direct recruitment of sales personnel with specific backgrounds for each sales campaign. Usually the sales executives will be part of a team that may include telemarketing, [[marketing]], tools systems and methodologies as well as [[sales management]].
Sales [[outsourcing]] firms provide [[accountability]] regarding all sales results and activities while representing the brand of the client. For the end-customer, it usually appears as if the sales team sold the product themselves rather than the sales outsourcing firm. The outsourcing firm is, in essence, an extension of the client but is responsible for all operations associated with direct sales activities, often receiving sales engineering and initial product/service [[training]] support from the client.
== Purpose of indirect sales == The sole purpose of a contract sales organization is to provide sales resource to its clients, without taking title to their products. Sales outsourcing providers include [[manufacturers' representative]]s, contract sales organizations, sales agents or sales outsourcing consultants. One way of organising the sales effort, especially when product delivery is erratic, is to replace or supplement internal resources with [[wikt:function|functionality]] and expertise brought in from contract sales organisations.
Sales outsourcing is quite different from large-scale service outsourcing, which has its advantages but also requires pro-active contract and relationship management.<ref>{{cite book|last=Anderson|first=E|title=Outsourcing the sales function: The real cost of field sales|year=2005|publisher=Thomson/South-western|location=Mason, Ohio|author2=Trinkle }}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last=Novick|first=H. J.|title=Selling through independent reps|year=2000|publisher=AMACOM|location=New York, NY}}</ref> In addition to full sales outsourcing, many partial models are observed, particularly in large firms.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Rogers|first=B|title=An exploratory study of the make-or-buy decision in pharmaceutical sales|journal=Journal of Medical Marketing|year=2009|volume=9|issue=1|pages=11–20|doi=10.1057/jmm.2008.32}}</ref>
== Advantages ==
Sales outsourcing is expected to be cheaper than the fully loaded cost of employing salespeople, but calculating the cost comparison over time is far from straightforward. Nevertheless, replacing fixed costs with variable costs is attractive to budget-holders.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Rogers|first=B|title=An exploratory study of the make-or-buy decision in pharmaceutical sales|journal=Journal of Medical Marketing|year=2009|volume=9|issue=1|pages=11–20|doi=10.1057/jmm.2008.32}}</ref> However, unlike many forms of outsourcing, the advantages of sales outsourcing does not often come from saving costs but rather increasing [[revenue]] or providing speed of response or flexibility.
The [[business case]] for sales outsourcing should also include consideration of the cost of controlling the contract. Difficulty in measuring the link between sales activity and sales performance leads to a preference for employed salespeople.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Krafft|first=M |author2=Albers, S. |author3=Lal, R.|title=Relative Explanatory Power of Agency Theory and Transaction Cost Analysis in German Salesforces|journal=International Journal of Research in Marketing|year=2004|volume=21|issue=3|pages=265–283|doi=10.1016/j.ijresmar.2003.11.001}}</ref> However, the issues internally are often the same and the internal hire has many other corporate "distractions" that do not occur with external resources.
Companies may also choose sales outsourcing as a means of accessing the best sales skills.<ref>{{cite book|last=Anderson|first=E|title=Outsourcing the sales function: The real cost of field sales|year=2005|publisher=Thomson/South-western|location=Mason, Ohio|author2=Trinkle }}</ref> Although the [[pejorative]] term “rent-a-rep” is still used, there is some evidence that contractors are perceived as good performers against qualitative as well as quantitative performance criteria.<ref>{{cite book|last=Anderson|first=E|title=Outsourcing the sales function: The real cost of field sales|year=2005|publisher=Thomson/South-western|location=Mason, Ohio|author2=Trinkle }}</ref> Even so, the reputational risk of third parties handling customer relationships has been observed as a factor restricting sales outsourcing.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Weiss|first=A M |author2=Anderson E |author3=MacInnis D J|title=Reputation Management as a Motivation for Sales Structure Decisions|journal=Journal of Marketing|year=1999|volume=63|pages=74–89|doi=10.2307/1251975}}</ref> One could argue that an employee is often using a company to gain 2–3 years salary and experience whereas a sales outsourcing firm would usually be looking at a long term contract even though the staff may change during that time. So the aims of an outsourcer can be closely aligned with the aims and objectives of the contracting company.
A recent study has highlighted flexibility as an important driver for outsourcing sales.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Rogers|first=B|title=An exploratory study of the make-or-buy decision in pharmaceutical sales|journal=Journal of Medical Marketing|year=2009|volume=9|issue=1|pages=11–20|doi=10.1057/jmm.2008.32}}</ref> Uncertain business environments accentuate the need to turn sales resource on and off quickly. Industries and companies undergoing rapid change may need to avoid hiring and firing costs and risks.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Downey|first=J. M.|title=Risks of outsourcing - applying risk management to staffing methods|journal=Facilities|year=1995|volume=13|series=9/10|pages=38–44|doi=10.1108/02632779510095617}}</ref> Contract sales organizations can absorb employment risk, enabling their clients to respond to short-term opportunities or competitor activity (see [[Lean startup#Philosophy|Lean startup]]). However, an outsourcer may build in more of a premium to the rate or commission if excessive flexibility is required on a contract.
Contract sales organizations are growing in volume and influence, able to provide both tactical activity and long-term strategic support to their clients.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Rogers|first=B|title=Contract sales organizations (CSOs): making the transition from tactical resource to strategic partnering|journal=Journal of Medical Marketing|year=2008|volume=8|series=1|pages=39–47|doi=10.1057/palgrave.jmm.5050119}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.salespartnerships.com/resources/articles/contract-pharmaceutical-sales-pharma-landscape|title=Contract Pharmaceutical Sales: The Changing Pharma Landscape|date=2017-09-06|work=Sales Partnerships|access-date=2017-10-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
Speed of response is seen as a key reason to use an outsourcer. If a company was looking to enter a market it may take several months to recruit the local manager which then takes several months to find an office and build a team. With an outsourcer, a full working team can oftentimes be operational within a matter of days or weeks.<ref>{{citation|last=Poulter|first=Julian|title=Selling People Ltd|newspaper=Sales outsourcing alternatives|date=2005-05-21}}</ref>
Sales outsourcing can also be used as a [[market entry strategy]] and avoids [[permanent establishment]] risk.
==Indirect sales growth rate== The experience of many organizations over the past several years demonstrates that indirect channels can be critical to expanding market coverage. This has been particularly true in the [[electronics]], [[communications]] and [[high tech]] sectors.<ref>{{cite web|last=Chugg|first=Justin|title=What is a Master Agent?|url=http://www.telarus.com/why-telarus.php|publisher=Telecom Channel News|accessdate=10 March 2012}}</ref> For example, the indirect channel now accounts for 66 percent of overall technology sales, up from 53 percent in 1997.
==Examples of indirect sales companies== Some examples of communications companies who employ indirect sales forces to their internal sales efforts include: [[Airespring|AireSpring]], [[AT&T]], [[Comcast]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Oborn|first=Patrick|title=Comcast Solution Provider Program|url=http://www.telarus.com/carrier-information/comcast-business.html|publisher=Telecom Channel Association|accessdate=4 February 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128124010/http://www.telarus.com/carrier-information/comcast-business.html|archivedate=28 January 2013|df=}}</ref> [[EarthLink|Earthlink Business]], [[Integra Telecom]], [[Level 3 Communications]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Holverson|first=Austin|title=Level 3 Debuts New Channel Partner Program; Introduces Tiered Structure and Enhanced Support Resources|url=http://www.telarus.com/industry/level-3-debuts-new-channel-partner-program;-introduces-tiered-structure-and-enhanced-support-resources.html|accessdate=4 February 2013|newspaper=Telecom Channel Updates|date=4 February 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130407082959/http://www.telarus.com/industry/level-3-debuts-new-channel-partner-program;-introduces-tiered-structure-and-enhanced-support-resources.html|archivedate=7 April 2013|df=}}</ref> [[Time Warner Cable]], [[TelePacific Communications|TelePacific]], [[tw telecom]], [[XO Communications]], and [[Windstream]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Chugg|first=Justin|title=Carriers in the Channel|url=http://www.telarus.com/carriers.html|publisher=Telecom Channel Updates|accessdate=6 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226073857/http://www.telarus.com/carriers.html|archivedate=26 February 2012|df=}}</ref> Some top sales agencies who sell voice and data services for these carriers include [[Telarus]], based in [[Salt Lake City, Utah]], Intelisys, based in [[Petaluma, California]], and Telecom Brokerage Inc (TBI), based in [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Henderson|first=Khali|title=Comcast Agent Program|url=http://www.telarus.com/carrier-information/comcast-business.html|accessdate=14 March 2011|newspaper=Channel Partners|date=14 March 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110320204929/http://www.telarus.com/carrier-information/comcast-business.html|archivedate=20 March 2011|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Chugg|first=Justin|title=Comcast Business Services Enters Into Master Agent Agreement with Telarus|url=http://www.telarus.com/news/comcast-business-services-enters-into-master-agent-agreement-with-telarus.html|accessdate=14 March 2011|newspaper=Telarus Industry News Briefs|date=14 March 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110321221607/http://www.telarus.com/news/comcast-business-services-enters-into-master-agent-agreement-with-telarus.html|archivedate=21 March 2011|df=}}</ref>

Eduardo Sarao | products = [[Jeepney]] | production = 12 to 15 units per day (peak)Santos, Michelle D. [http://www.tofil.ph/greatleaders.php?id=67 "Greatest leaders in our midst - Mr. Leonardo S. Sarao, Sr."]. TOFIL Online. Retrieved on 2013-04-06. |homepage = https://www.facebook.com/saraomotors/ | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | footnotes = | intl = | bodystyle = }} '''Sarao Motors, Inc.''' is a Filipino [[automotive]] [[manufacturing company]] headquartered in [[Barangay|Brgy.]] Pulang Lupa in the city of [[Las Piñas]] in [[Metro Manila]], [[Philippines]]. The company designs, engineers, manufactures and distributes the [[jeepney]], the most popular form of transportation in the country, labeled as the 'king of the road' in the Philippines.[http://laspinascity.gov.ph/home/article?cat=ls&sub=Sarao+Jeepney "Sarao Jeepney"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130524011730/http://laspinascity.gov.ph/home/article?cat=ls&sub=Sarao+Jeepney |date=2013-05-24 }}. The Official Website of Las Piñas City. Retrieved on 2013-04-08.[http://stuartxchange.org/Jeepney.html "Jeepney"]. Stuart Exchange. Retrieved on 2013-04-08. The company was first established as a small [[automotive]] shop in 1953 by starting [[entrepreneur]] [[Leonardo Sarao]], a mechanic and a former [[calesa]] driver. From an initial budget of [[Philippine peso|₱]]700, the company grew into a multimillion corporation. At its peak, the ratio of Sarao jeepneys rolling the streets of Manila outnumbered other names by nearly 7 to 1, the name ''Sarao'' became synonymous with the vehicle. Sarao promoted the jeepney as a symbol of [[Culture of the Philippines|Philippine culture]]. A Sarao was exhibited at the Philippine pavilion at the [[1964 New York World's Fair]] as a national image for the Filipinos.Mercado, Leonardo N. [http://www.crvp.org/book/Series03/III-8/chapter_x.htm "The Filipino Mind - Chapter X: Microcosms, THE JEEPNEY AS MICROCOSM"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121009110332/http://www.crvp.org/book/Series03/III-8/chapter_x.htm |date=2012-10-09 }}. Council for Research in Values and Philosophy. Retrieved on 2013-04-12. In 1971, a Sarao jeepney traveled from [[Manila]] to [[London]] and all over Europe as the Phlippine icon of the ''London-Manila Express'', a roadshow sponsored by the Philippine Tourism and Travel Association to boost the country's tourism and industry to European countries.saraocraft (2005-04-16). [https://www.flickr.com/photos/20068514@N00/3823179352/in/set-72157621985822398 "23 LONDON MANILA Jeepney Express"]. Flickr.com. Retrieved on 2013-04-13.[http://www.bayanihannationaldanceco.ph/milestones1980_1970.html "Bayanihan International Milestones"]. Bayanihan National Dance Company. Retrieved on 2013-04-13.saraocraft (2005-04-16). [https://www.flickr.com/photos/20068514@N00/3799996569/ "london manila express 1971"]. Flickr.com. Retrieved on 2013-04-13. Sarao is also a manufacturer of owner-type, custom-built jeepneys and other type of vehicles for schools, businesses and other institutions. [[Pope John Paul II]] rode on a specially built owner-type jeepney by Sarao during his first travel to the country in 1981.saraocraft (2005-04-16). [https://www.flickr.com/photos/20068514@N00/3823178916/in/set-72157621985822398 "15 Pope John Paul"]. Flickr.com. Retrieved on 2013-04-13. On October 2, 2000 Sarao Motors was forced to halt jeepney production due to rising costs.{{cite news|title=Jeepney maker stopsproduction|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2479&dat=20001004&id=tVg1AAAAIBAJ&sjid=gSUMAAAAIBAJ&pg=3049,32261576|accessdate=2014-07-23|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=2000-10-04}} Sarao Motors' employees were downsized from 300 to only 50. The collection department was the only part of the company that remained operational.{{cite news|title=Sarao brakes to a full stop|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2479&dat=20001008&id=uVg1AAAAIBAJ&sjid=gSUMAAAAIBAJ&pg=2007,33971631|accessdate=2014-07-23|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=2000-10-08}} Sarao Motors eventually resumed its operation albeit in a lesser scale.{{cite news|last1=Madrona|first1=Mark|title=Reviving the iconic Sarao jeepney|url=https://ph.news.yahoo.com/blogs/the-inbox/reviving-iconic-sarao-jeepney-120454562.html|accessdate=2014-07-23|work=VERA Files|date=2011-11-16}}{{cite news|last1=Palma|first1=Andre|title=Hybrid Economics|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2479&dat=20050112&id=Nlg1AAAAIBAJ&sjid=kCUMAAAAIBAJ&pg=3360,4670205|accessdate=2014-07-23|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=2005-06-12|quote=Good news for Filipino motorist, Sarao, the iconic jeepney builder is still open. In reaction to the last week's column that mentioned "sadly defunct Sarao", I received an email and production photos from Ed Sarao showing otherwise.}} [[File:Jeepney-Jan73 (25).jpg|thumb|left|A Sarao jeepney in a Philippine street in 1973]] {{clear}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[https://www.flickr.com/photos/20068514@N00/3726606732/in/set-72157621985822398 A Sarao jeepney manufactured in 1955] {{coord|14|28|21|N|120|58|30|E|region:PH_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Motor vehicle manufacturers of the Philippines]] [[Category:Companies based in Las Piñas]] [[Category:Vehicle manufacturing companies established in 1953]] [[Category:Philippine brands]]

{{Infobox person | name =Shahriar Sayeed Husain | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | residence = [[Dhaka]] | death_date = | death_place = | cause = | resting_place = | nationality = [[Bangladesh]]i | occupation = Business | spouse = [[Farah Mahbub (judge)|Farah Mahbub]] | parents = Altaf Husain (father)
Nazia Husain (mother) | children = Amantul Iffat Fareesah Husain }} '''Shahriar Sayeed Husain''' is a [[Bangladesh]]i businessman, who owned; including his business partner Abul Hashem Fakir ;Shahriar Fabrics and Spectrum Sweater Industries{{cite news|title=BGMEA requests home minister to free garment products from Shahriar Fabrics|url=http://bdnews24.com/business/2005/04/18/bgmea-requests-home-minister-to-free-garment-products-from-shahriar-fabrics|accessdate=19 October 2016|work=bdnews24.com|date=18 April 2005}} which [[2005 Savar building collapse|collapsed]] in [[Savar]], a sub-district near [[Dhaka]], Bangladesh ==Spectrum factory collapse== {{Main article|2005 Savar building collapse}} On around 00:45am, 11 April 2005, the nine-storied Spectrum factory in Savar collapsed. The death toll of the collapse is 73 and around 80 people were injured.{{cite news|last1=Buerk|first1=Roland|title=Bail denied over factory collapse|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/4529043.stm|accessdate=19 October 2016|work=BBC News|date=9 May 2005}} ==Arrest and trial== Shahriar Sayeed Hossain and Abul Hashem Fakir surrendered to the court on 9 May 2005 after hiding since the disaster. They are accused of causing death by negligence. Only after few days, on 24 May both of them got bail and later the two accused discharged from the trial court. The High Court took the consideration of the case that was filed by police not by any of the victims.{{cite news|last1=Islam|first1=Udisa|title=Spectrum factory collapse slides into oblivion|url=http://archive.dhakatribune.com/labour/2014/apr/11/spectrum-factory-collapse-slides-oblivion|accessdate=19 October 2016|work=Dhaka Tribune|date=11 April 2014}} Still, there is a writ petition file by four injured workers to be determined. ==Personal life== Husain married to [[Farah Mahbub (judge)|Farah Mahbub]]. His wife is a [[Dhaka High Court|high court]] justice and his father-in-law, [[Mahbubur Rahman (politician)|Mahbubur Rahman]]{{cite news|last1=Islam|first1=Shariful|last2=Ashraf|first2=Shamim|title=9-storey Garment Building Crumbles at Savar|url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/2005/04/12/d5041201011.htm|accessdate=19 October 2016|work=The Daily Star|date=12 April 2005}} is a lawyer and ex [[Jatiyo Sangshad|Member of Parliament]]. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Husain, Shahriar Sayeed}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bangladeshi businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Dhaka]] {{Bangladesh-bio-stub}}

A '''stalking horse offer''', '''agreement''', or '''bid''' is an attempt by a bankrupt [[debtor]] to test the market for the debtor's assets in advance of an auction of them.<ref>[http://lexicon.ft.com/term.asp?t=stalking-horse Financial Times Lexicon] from the ''Financial Times''</ref><ref name=investopedia.>{{cite web|title=Stalking-Horse Bid|url=http://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/stalkinghorsebid.asp|website=investopedia.com|accessdate=9 January 2016}}</ref> The intent is to maximize the value of its [[asset]]s or avoid low bids, as part of (or before) a [[court auction]].<ref>[http://www.focusmg.com/articles/stalking-horse The ‘Stalking Horse’ in a US Chapter 11 363 Sale], ''Financier Worldwide''’s May 2006 Edition </ref>
== Procedure ==
While entering a [[stalking horse]] offer, the debtor can offer [[bidding]] protections such as [[breakup fee]]s to its best bidder before the auction. These incentives enhance the value of the offering for the bidder which might lead to a better price offer before the auction begins. This higher offer is now the starting offer for the auction and may result in benefiting the debtor and its [[Estate (law)|estate]].
==Examples== On October 22, 2007, technology company [[SCO Group|SCO]] asked a bankruptcy court to approve a deal whereby a purchaser would acquire "substantially all assets used by the Company in connection with its SCO [[UNIX]] Business and certain related claims in litigation." <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1102542/000095013407021831/v34793e8vk.htm |title=The SCO Group, Inc. |work=Form 8-K |publisher=SEC.gov |date= October 22, 2007|accessdate=2013-09-24}}</ref> The agreement included a "stalking horse" provision: If the purchaser, York Capital Management, were to be designated as a stalking horse in subsequent bidding for SCO's assets, and if others outbid York, then SCO would have to pay York a $780,000 breakup fee and reimbursement of all expenses incurred by York up to $300,000. In this way, York would earn its expenses and $780,000 by acting as the stalking horse and preventing other bidders from making lowball offers.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.groklaw.net/article.php?story=20071023172159177 |title= SCO Has a Bid; Would Like More - Updated |publisher= Groklaw |date= 2007-10-23 |accessdate= 2013-09-24}}</ref>
On August 4, 2008, Steve and Barry's LLC, a [[retailer]] of casual apparel, filed a stalking horse agreement with the [[U.S. Bankruptcy Court]] for the [[Southern District of New York]]. Their partner in this [[asset purchase agreement]] was BH S&B Holding LLC, a subsidiary of [[Bay Harbor Management]].<ref>[http://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/google/?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20080804006183&newsLang=en "Steve & Barry’s Files “Stalking Horse” Agreement"], from Businesswire.com, 4 August 2008.</ref>
On July 27, 2009, ''The Wall Street Journal'' reported that Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson had won a stalking horse bid to acquire Nortel Networks Corp's CDMA division, for $1.13 billion. <ref>[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB124849670377181071#mod=djemITP "Ericsson Powers Up U.S. Presence With Nortel Deal"], from ''The Wall Street Journal'', 27 July 2009.</ref>
On July 8, 2010, the [[Texas Rangers (baseball)|Texas Rangers]] [[Major League Baseball]] team announced a potential stalking horse deal. "'An auction with a stalking horse, or minimum, bid is more frequently used than a so-called “naked” auction without a floor price,' William K. Snyder, the court-appointed restructuring officer, said. 'Moreover, the stalking horse bidder commonly receives a “reasonable” break-up fee if unsuccessful in the auction,' said Snyder. Under the scrapped plan, the $304 million in cash portion of the Greenberg-Ryan group’s May 24 deal with owner Tom Hicks would serve as a minimum bid, with the next bid at least $20 million higher. Greenberg-Ryan would have received $15 million if it lost." <ref>[http://www.star-telegram.com/2010/07/08/2323117/texas-rangers-proposed-july-16.html#ixzz0t9CX7uO2 Texas Rangers' Proposed July 16 Auction Scrapped]{{dead link|date=September 2013}}</ref>
On February 21, 2011, ''Reuters'' reported [[Blockbuster LLC|Blockbuster]]'s intention to pursue a $290 million stalking horse offer with Cobalt Video Holdco. <ref>[https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/21/us-blockbuster-idUSTRE71K5SO20110221 "Blockbuster gets $290 million stalking horse bid"], from ''Reuters'', 21 February 2011.</ref>
On April 4, 2011, ''TechCrunch'' reported [[Google]]'s intention to pursue a $900 million stalking horse bid for [[Nortel]]'s patents.<ref> [https://techcrunch.com/2011/04/04/google-makes-900-million-stalking-horse-bid-for-nortel-patents/ "Google Makes $900 Million Stalking-Horse Bid For Nortel Patents As It Looks To Fend Off Trolls"], from ''TechCrunch'', 4 April 2011.</ref>
In 2013, [[Hostess Brands]] used a stalking horse auction to sell off its assets in bankruptcy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hostess CEO Says Stalking-Horse Bids Total $858 Million|url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2013-01-31/hostess-ceo-says-stalking-horse-bids-total-858-million|author=Milford, P., McCarty, D.|publisher=Bloomberg|date=January 31, 2013|accessdate=2013-01-31}}</ref>
On October 17, 2013, Designline, now known as [[Environmental Performance Vehicles]] the Charlotte, NC bus manufacturer, used the technique but received no offers. <ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.scribd.com/doc/176993715/DesignLine-Stalking-Horse-Bidders|title = DesignLine Stalking Horse Bidders|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
On April 15, 2013, [[Eastman Kodak]] proposed a stalking horse deal of $210 million whereby [[Brother Industries]] would acquire Kodak's Document Imaging division ahead of Kodak's bankruptcy court approval slated for June 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kodak tentatively sells its scanning business to Brother for $210 million|url=https://www.engadget.com/2013/04/15/kodak-tentatively-sells-its-scanning-business-to-brother|last=Fingus|first=Jon|publisher=AOL|work= engadget.com|date=April 15, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-04-15}}</ref>
On June 10, 2016, [[Ziff Davis]] proposed a stalking-horse bid of under US$90 million after [[Gawker Media]] announced it was filing for [[Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2016/06/10/gawker-media-files-for-ch-11-bankruptcy-protection.html|title=Gawker Media auction starts with Ziff Davis bid amid bankruptcy|last=Balakrishnan|first=Anita|date=2016-06-10|website=CNBC|access-date=2016-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/11/business/media/gawker-bankruptcy-sale.html|title=Gawker, Filing for Bankruptcy After Hulk Hogan Suit, Is for Sale|last=Ember|first=Sydney|date=2016-06-10|newspaper=The New York Times|issn=0362-4331|access-date=2016-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/08/16/hogan-vs-gawker-aftermath-update-gawkers-bankruptcy-sale-unfolding-week/|title=Hogan vs. Gawker Aftermath – Univision reportedly to buy bankrupt Gawker|last=Caldwell|first=James|date=2016-08-16|website=PWTorch|access-date=2016-08-16}}</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Suleiman Bakhit | image = <!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = <!-- {{Birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Birth-date and age|birth date†}} for living people supply only the year unless the exact date is already widely published, as per [[WP:DOB]] --> | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|death date†|birth date†}} --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Jordan]]ian | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Suleiman Bakhit''' ([[Arabic]]: سليمان بخيت) is a [[Jordan]]ian entrepreneur who produces superhero comics in various media for [[Arab]] youth.<ref name=forbes>{{cite web| last =Upbin| first =Bruce| title =Arab Superheroes Vs. Arab Extremism| work =Forbes| date =July 12, 2011| url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/bruceupbin/2011/07/12/pow-crash-blam-superheroes-vs-arab-extremism/}}</ref> He has been described as "fighting to change how the West sees Arab youth — and how Arab youth see themselves — one superhero at a time."<ref name=ted>{{cite web| last =Eng| first =Karen| title =POW! Agent Hero: Fellows Friday with Suleiman Bakhit| work =TED| date =February 10, 2012| url = http://blog.ted.com/2012/02/10/pow-agent-hero-fellows-friday-with-suleiman-bakhit/}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Bakhit is the son of [[Marouf al-Bakhit]], who served twice as prime minister of Jordan.<ref name=forbes/> Bakhit has said that when he was a child, "I once had an art teacher who refunded my parents' money and advised me never to try again."<ref name=ted/> Suleiman studied at the [[University of Minnesota-Twin Cities]].<ref name=link>{{cite web| title =Suleiman Bakhit | work =LinkedIn| url = http://jo.linkedin.com/pub/suleiman-bakhit/16/108/764}}</ref> His original intention was to study mechanical engineering, but after "a couple years," he reportedly "found it utterly intolerable." Instead, he chose to pursue a master's degree in human resources development. His graduation thesis on this subject was "adopted by the Jordanian government."<ref name=forbes/><ref name=theac>{{cite web| title =The Accidental Comic Artist| work =The Accidental Career| url = http://www.theaccidentalcareer.com/suleiman_bakhit.html}}</ref>
He was at the University of Minnesota when [[9/11]] occurred. As president of the university's international student union, he began an "awareness campaign" to combat anti-Arab prejudice. The campaign received considerable media attention and shortly afterwards, Bakhit has said, "four college kids attacked me on my way home late one night. They started with racial slurs, then attacked me with beer bottles. I suffered many scars and injuries that led to surgeries." He decided, "Well, either I pack my bags and go home to Jordan, or I do something. And I decided the best way to fight racism is to start with the young. So I began talking to schoolchildren ages 6 and 7 about Middle Eastern culture and what happened to me on 9/11, spreading a very simple message: Not all Middle Easterners are terrorists, and [[Al Qaeda]] is like the [[KKK]]."<ref name=ted/> Eventually he "started realizing that mythology and stories have such great power to bridge cultural divides"<ref name=ted/> and also "realized the power of empowering youth and women through positive role models in a medium they can relate to: comics."<ref name=theac/>
In addition, he "realized that actually, no, there aren’t any Arab equivalents to Western superheroes. Yes, there’s [[Aladdin]] and [[Sinbad]], but no one has ever done an animation or comic book based on the actual mythology from within the culture." This recognition led Bakhit to do "a couple of years of hardcore research, reading ancient texts, doing six month's archeological research in the Arab desert. I even learned [[Hebrew]]. I wanted to read Aramaic so I could read the Dead Sea Scrolls for inspiration. Meanwhile, I started to teach myself to draw, and came up with some characters based on my knowledge of Arab culture. It was a journey towards discovering my own culture more than anything else." Over time, he has said, he became convinced that his calling was to create "characters and stories based in Arab tradition to spread the culture of tolerance."
==Return to Jordan and Aranim Media Factory== Consequently, he dropped out of the master's program in human resource development, returned to Jordan, and, in 2006, registered his company, Aranim. The name "comes from a combination of 'Arab' and 'anime.'"<ref name=ted/>
After returning to Jordan, Bakhit was physically attacked there, too, "this time," he has said, "for being such…a voice for moderation."<ref name=forbes/> According to his account, once he had "started publishing my comic books, especially the ones that fight extremism and terrorism, I got attacked outside of my office by a couple of extremists. One of them hit me with a razor blade in my face. He was trying to take out one of my eyes. Because it was late at night and I drive a motorbike, I had to cauterize my own wound with a pocketknife before getting to a hospital. That's how I ended up with a big, massive scar on my face."<ref name=ted/>
Aranim Media Factory, based in [[Amman]], has become one of the largest producers of comics in the Arab language, it produces comic books, TV and film cartoons, digital comic strips, manga, creative media, and social-media games.<ref name=forbes/><ref name=link/><ref name=theac/> His goal is “to entertain but more importantly to inspire Arab boys and girls to believe that real opportunities to be leaders are well within their grasp.”<ref name=forbes/> He describes himself as "dealing in hope and tolerance" and says that he wants "to build the Arab Disney."<ref name=forbes/> He has said: "I go to a lot of poor areas and ask the kids, 'Who are your role models?' Sometimes they say Zarqawi and Bin Laden. But in one neighborhood I gave them comics and when I went back a few months later; the superheroes were now their role models. It doesn't even have to be real people they look up to. There's a huge lack of positive role models in the region. Superheroes are an aspiration for what we want to be."<ref name=forbes/>
Bakhit develops "the concepts, characters and stories" for his comic books, and has a team of writers and artists who translate his ideas into the final product. He also runs "focus groups to gauge what kids respond to." He and his programmers, Jordanian natives, "learned from scratch how to program games. We bought books on Amazon and literally taught ourselves how to program, using blogs and online communities for support." He has said that his firm is "the only Arab company in the entire Arab world that creates social games in-house at the quality that we do."<ref name=ted/>
As an example of the fact that his stories "have deep Middle Eastern mythologies ingrained in them," Bakhit has explained that "in ancient Arabic mythology, fire has seven types, each color corresponding to a different one. So I gave Naar — which means 'fire' — the first hero of my first comic, the power of the seven flames. The story is about a group of kids who wake up in a future post-apocalyptic Middle East to discover they have superpowers." He has created another comic "based on Jordan's real-life all-female counterterrorism team," an example of his belief "in empowering young women," and has created a character named Element Zero, "a special agent, kind of the Arabic Jason Bourne or Jack Bauer, who fights terrorism locally."<ref name=ted/>
In January 2010, Bakhit founded Aranim Games.<ref name=link/> As of July 2011, his firms had sold 1.2 million copies of print comics. In 2011, Aranim Games launched "a FarmVille-style social game called Happy Oasis" which allows players to build a "garden in traditional Islamic style."<ref name=forbes/> In 2012, he invented an iPhone game that he described as "combining the Arab Spring and Animal Farm." He has also produced "a web TV show based on Element Zero character."<ref name=ted/>
==Other activities== During the [[2011 Libyan Civil War|Libyan Civil War]], Bakhit and another TED Fellow, [[Adrian Hong]], created "sort of a channel between Libya and Jordan to try to help some of the injured civilians come to Jordanian hospitals." As a result, "over 15,000 injured civilians got treated in Jordanian hospitals."<ref name=ted/>
Bakhit was named a 2011 [[TED (conference)|TED]] Global Fellow.<ref name=theac/> He spoke at the TED Global conference in [[Edinburgh]] in 2011.<ref name=forbes/>
Bakhit is scheduled to speak at the [[Oslo Freedom Forum]] in May 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oslofreedomforum.com/pdfs/OFF14Speakers.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-07-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140421115035/http://www.oslofreedomforum.com/pdfs/OFF14Speakers.pdf |archivedate=2014-04-21 |df= }}</ref>

{{For|the Jully Black song|Sweat of Your Brow}} [[File:'The feast of reason, and the flow of soul,' - ie - the wits of the age, setting the table in a roar by James Gillray.jpg|thumb|right|300px|As [[James Gillray]], the artist of this 1797 etching, died in 1815, his works are in the [[public domain]] throughout the world. However, under the "sweat of the brow" doctrine, new copyright claims could be made over mechanical reproductions of the etching, due to the skill and labor involved in the reproduction.]]
'''Sweat of the brow''' is an [[intellectual property]] [[Legal doctrine|law doctrine]], chiefly related to [[copyright]] law. According to this doctrine, an [[author]] gains rights through simple diligence during the creation of a work, such as a database, or a directory. Substantial creativity or "originality" is not required.
Under a "sweat of the brow" doctrine, the creator of a copyrighted work, even if it is completely unoriginal, is entitled to have his effort and expense protected, and no one else may use such a work without permission, but must instead recreate the work by independent research or effort. The classic example is a [[telephone directory]]. In a "sweat of the brow" jurisdiction, such a directory may not be copied, but instead a competitor must independently collect the information to issue a competing directory. The same rule generally applies to databases and lists of facts.
[[Civil law (legal system)|Civil law]] jurisdictions have traditionally used the similar but not identical concept of ''[[droit d'auteur]]''. [[European Union law]] tends to harmonize the protection of intellectual property throughout member states and the doctrine thus gains more influence. In the Databases Directive 96/9/EC{{emdash}}the [[Member State of the European Union|member states of the EU]] are obliged to confer protection known as the [[database right]] on non-original databases, that is on those that embody no creativity, but are a consequence of substantial investment (financial, labour etc.).<ref>[http://www.bonnanwalt.de/rg/internet/law/eu/RiLi96-9-eg.html EU Richtlinie 96/9/EG] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070621055429/http://www.bonnanwalt.de/rg/internet/law/eu/RiLi96-9-eg.html |date=2007-06-21 }} {{de icon}}</ref>
==Etymology== In a traditional [[English language|English]] [[idiom]], the ''sweat of one's brow'' refers to the effort expended in labor, and the value created thereby.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://machaut.uchicago.edu/cgi-bin/WEBSTER.page.sh?page=1457|page=1457|accessdate=2007-05-30|work=Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary (1913 ed)|title=Sweat, v. t.|publisher=ARTFL Project|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060303004057/http://machaut.uchicago.edu/cgi-bin/WEBSTER.page.sh?page=1457|archivedate=2006-03-03|df=}}</ref> The phrase is famously used in English translations of {{sourcetext|source=Bible|version=King James|book=Genesis|chapter=3|verse=19}}.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newlivingtranslation.com/05discoverthenlt/ssresults.asp?txtSearchString=Genesis+3|accessdate=2007-05-30|title=New Living Translation|publisher=Tyndale House Publishers, inc.|quote=By the sweat of your brow will you have food to eat}}</ref> The law doctrine takes its name from this idiom.
==By country==
===United States=== {{see also|Copyright law in the United States}} The [[United States]] rejected this doctrine in the 1991 [[United States Supreme Court]] case ''[[Feist Publications v. Rural Telephone Service]]'';<ref>{{ussc|499|340|1991}}</ref> until then it had been upheld in a number of US copyright cases.{{citation needed|date=March 2015}}
Under the ''Feist'' ruling in the US, mere collections of facts are considered unoriginal and thus not protected by copyright, no matter how much work went into [[collation|collating]] them. The arrangement and presentation of a collection may be original, but not if it is "simple and obvious" such as a list in [[alphabetical]] or [[chronological]] order.
===United Kingdom=== Under the [[Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988]], for copyright to subsist in a work, that work must be original. However, courts have not adopted a literal reading of this requirement. For over a hundred years, English courts have held that a significant expenditure of labour is sufficient. The consequence of this is that if A makes a work, in which copyright subsists, and B subsequently adds his skill, judgement and labour, altering the form of A's work, B will potentially have a copyright in the work he produces. This suggests that copyright is not about protecting ideas, because one can acquire a copyright by expending skill, labour, and judgement, but no creativity or inventiveness.
However, in March 2012, a case was taken to the [[European Court of Justice]], in which [[Football DataCo]] claimed [[copyright infringement]] over web sites which were reproducing match schedules from several major [[association football|football]] leagues. Football DataCo asserted that these schedules were copyrighted works due to the skill and labour involved in their preparation, and that the company was given exclusive rights to license their reproduction. Based on its interpretation of British law, the court rejected the notion that labour and skill was enough to grant protection to a work, since "unless the procedures for creating the lists concerned as described by the national court are supplemented by elements reflecting originality in the selection or arrangement of the data contained in those lists, they do not suffice for those lists to be protected by the copyright laid down in the directive."<ref name=bbcn-dataco>{{cite web|last=Wilson|first=Bill|title=Football match fixture list copyright claim rejected|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-17218968|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=6 March 2012}}</ref>
In a copyright notice on 'digital images, photographs and the internet' last updated in November 2015, the UK [[Intellectual Property Office (United Kingdom)|Intellectual Property Office]] confirmed that digital reproductions of [[public domain]] images are not protected by copyright, arguing that "according to the Court of Justice of the European Union which has effect in UK law, copyright can only subsist in subject matter that is original in the sense that it is the author’s own ‘intellectual creation’. Given this criterion, it seems unlikely that what is merely a retouched, digitised image of an older work can be considered as ‘original’."<ref name=IPO-cnote>{{cite web|author=UK Intellectual Property Office|title=Copyright Notice: digital images, photographs and the internet|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/481194/c-notice-201401.pdf|accessdate=3 December 2015}}</ref>
====Examples==== In ''[[Walter v Lane]]'' (1900) (Pre-CDPA), reporters took shorthand notes of a speech, punctuated them, etc. and published them in the [[The Times|''Times'']] newspaper. The court held that the reporters were authors of the published speech, and, as such, owned a copyright in the published speeches, because of the considerable skill, labour, and judgement they exercised.
In ''[[University of London Press Ltd v University Tutorial Press Ltd]]'',<ref>University of London Press v University Tutorial [1916] 2 Ch 601</ref> the question arose as to whether certain mathematics exam papers were original literary works. The exam papers just consisted of conventional maths problems in a conventional manner. The court held that originality does not mean that the work must be an expression of individual thought. The simple fact that the authors drew on a body of knowledge common to mathematicians did not compromise originality. The requirement of originality, it was held, does not require that expression be in an original or novel form. It does, however, require that the work not be copied from another work. It must originate from the author. As such, even though these were the same old maths problems every student is familiar with, and even though there was no creative input, the skill, labour, and judgement of the authors was sufficient to make the papers original literary works.
In ''[[Cummins v Bond]]'', a psychic in a trance claimed to have written down what spirits told her, through a process of [[automatic writing]]. In court, she accepted that she was not the creative author of the writing. The creative input, had, presumably, come from the spirits.<ref>{{cite web|author=William Patry |url=http://williampatry.blogspot.gr/2005/08/authorship-and-religion.html |title=The Patry Copyright Blog: Authorship and Religion |publisher=Williampatry.blogspot.gr |date=2005-08-10 |accessdate=2013-10-02}}</ref> Nonetheless, the court held that she had exercised sufficient labour and skill in translating and transcribing what the spirits told her, so she had a copyright in the resulting literary work.{{citation needed|date=September 2013}}
===Germany=== In certain cases, German law grants ancillary copyrights (''Leistungsschutzrecht'') due to the effort involved in the production or exploitation of creative works.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Nolte|first1=Georg|title=Zur Forderung der Presseverleger nach Einführung eines speziellen Leistungsschutzrechts: Eine kritische Auseinandersetzung|journal=Zeitschrift für Geistiges Eigentum|date=1 July 2010|volume=2|issue=2|pages=165–195|doi=10.1628/186723710792175149|url=http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/mohr/zge/2010/00000002/00000002/art00002|language=de}}</ref> In 2016, a [[Landgericht Berlin|regional court in Berlin]] ruled that digitized versions of public domain paintings were entitled to new copyrights due to the effort and expertise necessary to create the reproductions. The case is being appealed.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Moody|first1=Glyn|title=Digitising public domain images creates a new copyright, rules German court [Updated]|url=http://arstechnica.co.uk/tech-policy/2016/06/digitising-public-domain-images-creates-a-new-copyright-germany/|website=Ars Technica UK|accessdate=5 July 2016|date=23 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite court|litigants=Reiss-Engelhorn Museum (REM) of the City of Mannheim v. Wikimedia Foundation|url=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/foundation/5/52/Reiss-Engelhorn_Museum_%28REM%29_of_the_City_of_Mannheim_v._Wikimedia_Foundation_Landgericht.pdf|court=Landgericht Berlin|date=2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref>
===Israel=== Israeli law requires that a work exhibit some [[threshold of originality|degree of originality]] in order to be copyrightable. In other words, Israeli law does not subscribe to the "sweat of the brow" doctrine.<ref>Tempska, Urzula (2002). [http://scholarship.law.marquette.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1036&context=iplr "'Originality' After the Dead Sea Scrolls Decision: Implications for the American Law of Copyright"]. ''Marquette Intellectual Property Law Review'' '''6''' (1): 132.</ref> However, the amount of originality required is minimal, and the transliteration or interpretation of an artifact is covered by copyright.<ref>Elkin-Koren, Niva (2001). [http://www.houstonlawreview.org/archive/downloads/38-2_pdf/HLR38P445.pdf "Of Scientific Claims and Proprietary Rights: Lessons from the Dead Sea Scrolls"], ''Houston Law Review'' '''38''' (2): 458, 460.</ref>
===Uruguay=== Uruguayan law requires that the work should have some degree of originality to be protected by copyright. Uruguayan law, therefore, does not subscribe to the sweat of the brow doctrine.{{Citation needed|date=August 2013}}
==See also== *[[Liberalism#Classical_and_modern|Lockean Classical liberalism]] *[[Labour theory of value]] *[[Sui generis database right]] *[[Sweat equity]] *[[Threshold of originality]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}

{{Infobox person | name = Tarek Aggad | image = Mr. Tarek Aggad.jpg | image_size = | caption = Tarek Aggad | birth_name = Tarek Omar Abdul Fattah Aggad | birth_date = {{birth based on age as of date |45|2017|01|16|df=yes}}<ref>{{cite web|author=Tarek Omar Abdul Fattah Al-Aggad |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=69400382&privcapId=30746670 |title=Tarek Omar Abdul Fattah Al-Aggad: Executive Profile & Biography |publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] |date= |accessdate=2017-01-17}}</ref> | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = | education = | alma mater = [[Harvard University]] | occupation = Chairman, CEO and 27% owner, [[Arab Palestinian Investment Company]] | known for = | boards = | salary = | networth = | spouse = Shirine Aggad | parents = [[Omar Aggad]] | children = | relations = | website = }}
'''Tarek Omar Abdul Fattah Aggad ''' (born 1971/72) ({{lang-ar|تارک عمر عبدل عقاد}})is a [[Saudi]] businessman. He is the executive director of the Aggad Investment Company (AICO) - a Saudi diversified holding firm.<ref name="AICO">{{cite web|url=http://www.aico.com.sa/en/profile.html |title=Aico.com |website=Aico.com.sa |date= |accessdate=2016-04-11}}</ref> Aggad sits on the board of directors of several manufacturing, distribution and services companies in Palestine, Jordan and Saudi Arabia. In 1994, the [[Arab Palestinian Investment Company]] (APIC) was founded by his father [[Omar Aggad]]. It is an investment company with nine subsidiaries in the fields of consumer goods, pharmaceuticals, cars, retail and construction materials and Tarek Aggad is the chairman, CEO,<ref name="APIC_Home">{{cite web|title=APIC Home Page|url=http://www.apic.ps/english.php|website=APIC|accessdate=4 May 2016}}</ref> and owner of 27% of the company.<ref>{{cite web|last=Fox |first=Marisa |url=http://www.haaretz.com/middle-east-news/1.713347 |title=Panama Papers: Leaks reveal Abbas' son's $1m holding in company with ties to Palestinian Authority - Middle East News |publisher=[[Haaretz]] |date=2016-04-07 |accessdate=2017-01-17}}</ref>
Since its founding, APIC has become one of the largest operators in Palestine, employing over 1600 employees. Subsidiaries of APIC offer a wide array of products and services through distribution rights agreements with multinational companies that include Philip Morris, Procter & Gamble, Kellogg's, Hyundai, Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, Alfa Romeo, Fiat, Fiat Professional, XL Energy, Abbott, B. Braun, Eli Lilly, GlaxoSmithKline, Sanofi Aventis and Nivea, among many others.<ref name="APIC_Home" />
==Early life== Aggad was born in Lebanon in 1971, the son of [[Omar Aggad]], and grew up in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia where he attended local schools. He holds a bachelor's degree in Economics from [[Harvard University]], US.<ref name="Tarek_Bio">{{cite web|title=Tarek O. Aggad, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (APIC), Executive Director, Aggad Investment Company, Saudi Arabia|url=http://www.apic.ps/page.php?id=9c06y39942Y9c06|website=APIC|accessdate=4 May 2016}}</ref>
==Career== Aggad serves as a director on a number of boards including Aggad Investment Company, Palestine Investment Fund, Palestine Power Generation Company, Palestine Electric Company, Bank of Palestine, King Hussein Cancer Foundation, King’s Academy as well as other companies in Palestine, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.<ref name="AICO" />
In 2001, Aggad was named a Global Leader of Tomorrow (GLT) at the World Economic Forum in Davos. In 2006, President Mahmoud Abbas appointed Aggad as a director of the Palestine Investment Fund, the investment arm of the Palestinian people (PIF).<ref name="Tarek_Bio" />
==Personal life== He is married to Shirine Aggad, and they have four children.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kingsacademy.edu.jo/news-events/school-news/news-archive/2014-01/apic-establishes-scholarship-fund-palestinian-students-kings |title=APIC establishes scholarship fund for Palestinian students at King’s | King's Academy |website=Kingsacademy.edu.jo |date=2014-01-20 |accessdate=2016-04-11}}</ref>

The '''Boston Foundation''', founded in 1915, is one of the oldest and largest [[community foundation]]s in the United States.<ref name="2008 report">[http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/Utility_Navigation/Multimedia_Library/Reports/2008%20Annual%20Web.pdf AR]. (PDF) . Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Serving the Greater Boston area, it is made up of some 1,000 separate charitable funds established by thousands of donors over more than 100 years.<ref name="2008 report" /> Funds are established either for the general benefit of the community or for special purposes, such as supporting individual nonprofit organizations in perpetuity. With some $1 billion in assets, today the Foundation is one of the largest funders in New England. The Foundation and its donors make more than $100 million in grants every year.<ref name="2008 report" /> Since 2001, the Boston Foundation has also served as a major civic leader by commissioning and publishing research, providing a platform for discussion related to a wide range of challenges facing Greater Boston and the region and contributing to the development of public policy.
== History == The Boston Foundation was founded in 1915 by Charles E. and Charles M. Rogerson, who were father and son.<ref name="beginning">http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/There_at_the_Beginning/There%20from%20the%20Beginning.pdf</ref> Originally called the Permanent Charity Fund, it was one of the first community foundations in the United States, but, thanks to a bequest of $4 million shortly after it was launched, it was the first with the resources to begin grant making.<ref name="beginning" /> In 1959 another large bequest of $20 million catapulted the Foundation into an era during which it made early investments in some of the most important nonprofit institutions in Boston, from WGBH to the New England Aquarium to the clean up of Boston Harbor. 1985, the foundation was renamed the Boston Foundation, and Anna Faith Jones became the President—the first African-American woman to lead a major foundation in the United States. Today, it is led by President and CEO, Paul S. Grogan, who is credited with transforming the Foundation into a major civic leader for the city and region.<ref name="TBF-84">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=84 Meet Our President]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Mission == As Greater Boston’s community foundation since 1915, the Boston Foundation devotes its resources to building and sustaining a vital, prosperous city and region, where justice and opportunity are extended to everyone. It fulfills this mission in three principal ways:
* Making grants to nonprofit organizations and designing special funding initiatives to address this community’s critical challenges; * Working in partnership with donors to achieve [[High impact philanthropy|high-impact philanthropy]]; and * Serving as a civic hub and center of information, where ideas are shared, levers for change are identified, and common agendas for the future are developed. <ref name="TBF-80">[http://www.tbf.org/abouttbf/abouttbfdetail.aspx?id=80 Mission Statement]. Tbf.org (December 15, 2005). Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Governance == The Foundation is overseen by a 20-member Board of Directors, selected to represent diverse community interests.<ref name="TBF-82">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=82 Meet Our Board]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The staff includes professionals in grant making, philanthropy, finance and administration, public policy and communications.<ref name="TBF-100">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=100 TBF Staff]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Grant Making == Over more than 100 years of grantmaking, the Foundation has been there at the beginning for numerous fresh ideas and new institutions by providing crucial seed capital and other support.<ref name="beginning" /> Among its greatest accomplishments are grants that helped to launch [[WGBH-TV]], now considered the nation’s premier public television station.<ref name="beginning" /> It also made an early investment in the redevelopment of Faneuil Hall into a thriving marketplace, often credited with sparking the renewal of Boston in recent decades; and helped to shape Boston’s Longwood Medical Center area.<ref name="beginning" /> The Foundation invested in the most extensive network of community health centers in the nation and made grants to a group called Save the Harbor/Save the Bay to clean up Boston Harbor.<ref name="beginning" /> What was once one of the filthiest harbors in the world is now one of the cleanest.<ref name="beginning" /> It also made early grants to numerous organizations that started in Boston and spread throughout the country, like City Year, Citizen Schools and Year Up.<ref name="beginning" />
Today, the Foundation and its donors make grants<ref name="grants">[http://www.tbf.org/GrantSeekers/GrantSeekersHome.aspx Grant Seekers]. Tbf.org (July 1, 2011). Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> each year to hundreds of nonprofits in Greater Boston, across the country and around the world.<ref name="2008 report" /> In addition to placing a special strategic focus on the areas of Education, Health and Wellness, Jobs and Economic Development, Neighborhoods and Housing, and Arts and Culture. It also provides leadership for special initiatives, such as the Success Boston College Completion Initiative and SkillWorks.
== Civic leadership == Through its Understanding Boston series, the Boston Foundation commissions research from universities, think tanks and other organizations and shares this information through a series of forums that are attended by thousands of people every year.<ref name="UB">[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/Default.aspx The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Issues addressed through Understanding Boston embrace a broad range of issues, including public education, housing, the workforce, health, philanthropy and the nonprofit sector, the arts and the urban environment.<ref name="UB" />
In addition to providing fresh information and bringing people together to discuss findings, the Foundation also creates Task Forces and Action Agendas to produce positive change. A number of issues have been influenced by this process. The Commonwealth Housing Task Force created a Smart Growth housing effort to address the current shortage of housing in the state.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/chtf The Commonwealth Housing Task Force]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The program has led to dozens of towns and cities building thousands of new units of housing.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/tbfgen1.asp?id=1991 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The Foundation’s civic leadership also helped lead to the Massachusetts Cultural Facilities Fund, which has provided millions in state funding for cultural facilities.<ref>http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/There_at_the_Beginning/ThereForTheArts.pdf</ref> Its work examining the current Criminal Offender Record Information (CORI) system has led to a complete re-evaluation of the system by state law makers.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/CommunitySafety.aspx?id=6128 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The Foundation’s research and public information campaign related to public education has influenced former Governor Deval Patrick's approach to education across the state.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/Education.aspx?id=6130 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Other issues that have benefited from the Foundation’s civic leadership includea new collaborative for the life sciences, issues related to health and health care and the revenue-raising capacity of Massachusetts cities.<ref name="2008 report" />
== Boston Indicators Project == [http://www.bostonindicators.org/?q&sortBy=date&sortOrder=desc&page=1 Boston Indicators] is a research center at the Boston Foundation that seeks a thriving Greater Boston for all residents across all neighborhoods. They do this by analyzing key indicators of well-being and by researching promising ideas for making Boston more prosperous, equitable and just. To ensure that the Indicators work informs active efforts to improve our city, they work in deep partnership with community groups, civic leaders and Boston’s civic data community to produce special reports and host public convenings.
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * The [http://www.library.neu.edu/archives/collect/findaids/m127find.htm Persistent Poverty Project records, 1985–2002] are located in the Northeastern University Libraries, Archives and Special Collections Department, Boston, MA.
